   I'm back in SF, looking forward to a good weekend.  Tonight starts
   it off with the Stonesthrow Showcase party at DNA with a lot
   of turntable action, and the XLR8R party at Sound Design.  

   Friday features house, trance and jungle at Deep, Frequency, and
   the Trance & Jungle Factory party; or catch Scott Henry and Dara
   at Nikita.  Saturday is highly competitive with a big lineup
   at Bionic, a mostly local star lineup at Intoxication, a stop
   by the Ninjatune guys, the Green Gorilla Lounge down south, and
   the Pablo's Anniversary.


                              The SFR Calendar
                                      
           http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi
     _________________________________________________________________
   
   Thursday, April 2nd - Garnet presents Stonesthrow Showcase
   an exclusive gathering of Stonesthrow Records artists
   Peanut Butter Wolf, Kut Masta Kurt (Kool Keith DJ), J Rocc (Beat
   Junkies), MCs Rasco, Persevere, Lootpack, Grand from Homeliss Derilix,
   Fanatik, Rasta Cue Tip, DJ Serg, Grand Master Zest, Dave Dub.
   co produced by Beatsauce KUSF and Sebastien Events.
   21+. DNA Lounge, 375 11th St, SF. http://www.stonesthrow.com/
   415.436.0735
   
   Friday, April 3rd - Deep
   Joseph, Joe Rice, BioJeff.
   [5.1.98 - Ethan Miller, Alex]
   21+, $3. Il Pirata, 16th St & Potrero, SF. http://xinet.com/tony/deep/
   
   Friday, April 3rd - Formula 1 presents Frequency

                             Radio/TV/Net Shows
                                      
     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)

       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)

       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)

       (San Jose).

       breakbeat, hiphop, ambient, experimental.

                            Administrative Notes
                                      
   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
    Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.org

Hello Again,
We wanted to let you know about a few of our upcoming events in the San
Francisco area and we hope to see you at this incredible show. Also,
check out some music info from around the globe (Tokyo, London, Munich,
Iceland, New Orleans and New York) plus info on a special live webcast
from London. If you have some info you would like included in future
announcements, just email it to paulc@ontheone.com and we will try to
post it. Thanks for your support. 

SATURDAY, APRIL 4TH, ON THE ONE PRESENTS 
NINJA TUNE 5: FUNKUNGFUSION AT THE JUSTICE LEAGUE,628 DIVISADERO @HAYES/
LIMITED $10 ADVANCE TICKETS / $15 AT THE DOOR / 9PM-2AM /21+ID

FunKungFusion: phasechange; like veluminous slime at the water's edge or
the bambastic wonder of jazz at the edge of hip hop, techno and outrock;
Funkungfusion is Jackie Chan playing Herbie Hancock wearing George
Clinton's boots-y. Six DJs will be in the house representing Ninja
Tunes' diverse stable of dance floor hooligans, messing up headz and
kung fusin' on FIVE turntables and live VJ mixing. Representin' on the
Funkungfusion Tour will be:

THE HERBALISER (Jake Wherry & Ollie Teeba)
DJ VADIM 
CHOCALATE WEASEL (T Power's new project with partner Chris Stevens)
Live Performance by NEOTROPIC (Riz Maslen)
And live Ninja visuals by Ninja VJs HEXSTATIC 
Along with DJs Paul Craven (On The One) and Darkhorse (360 Records)

For more info you can check out these websites:
http://www.fabric8.com/oto
http://www.obsolete.com/pipe/ninja/
INFO: 415.331.1500 ext O.N.E.  or the Justice League 415.440.0409

ART OF THE NINJA: 
Ian Dury said "Do it yourself, it's cheaper and more fun" and he was
right. The only way to be real is to do it yourself. MATT BLACK and
JONATHON MORE's (a.k.a. Coldcut) near-death experiences with Big Life
and Arista Records convinced them that being as independent as possible
is of the essence. Ninja Tune was born out of a desire to side-step the
bull of major industry dealings, and over the last seven years the label
has continued to expand on the D.I.Y. philosophy that gave it birth.
Matt has a background in computers and biochemistry, Jonathon is a
former silversmith and art teacher. Having DJed at countless legendary
London parties they met at Reckless Records. Their mutual interest in
mixing led in Jan 87 to their first record, 'SAY KIDS, WHAT TIME IS
IT?', acknowledged as the first UK DJ 'sampling' record predating 'Pump
Up the Volume' (which actually samples Say Kids.) After this, their
notorious Remix for Eric B and Rakim's 'Paid In Full', brought major
acclaim. Big Life Records launched their artists Yazz and Lisa
Stansfield with Coldcut collaborations and productions.Throughout
Coldcut have maintained their commitment to the DIY & independent ethic.
After pressure from Arista to deliver more pop hits, they formed NINJA
TUNE/NTONE to provide a no bullshit outlet for their own music; Ninja
has since evolved into one of the most successful cutting edge
underground labels often credited with 'inventing' the 90s triphop
style, although they maintain that no-one 'invents' anything. Ninja's
diverse stable of artists continue this philosophy, funking up heads
across the globe with their eclectic blend of music selection and
multi-turntable tricknology.

THE HERBALISER - Jake Wherry and DJ Ollie Teeba are the Herbaliser.
Jake, grew up on a diet of jazz and James Brown. Ollie Teeba caught the
DJ bug at the age of 15 and progressed from spinning tunes in his
bedroom to playing clubs and warehouses. A mutual love of anything fat
and jazzy brought the pair together in 1992 and 'The Herbaliser' was
born. The Herbaliser sound lies between turntables and trombones,
updating a deep jazz and hiphop sound with today's sophisticated
production techniques, whilst keeping a vibrant feel to their music,
courtesy of some thumping double-bass, horn section and heavy use of
breaks. Current Release: Blow Your Headphones

DJ VADIM - Born in Russia, he has lived in London since the tender age
of three. His first release on Ninja Tune was "Non Lateral Hypothesis'
in April 1996. Apart from real Hip Hop, Vadim is inspired by creaking
doors, answering machines, musique concrete, running water and creates a
unique collage with, as main ingredients, the fattest, slowest, weirdest
beats ever recorded. Much deeper than Portishead, more daring than
Earthling, dope enough for B-boys, cool enough for Jazz Kats. Current
Release: USSR Reconstruction

CHOCOLATE WEASEL - The mighty T Power and his sampler-wielding
accomplice Chris Stevens burst open the righteous wardrobe and dust off
their spangled waistcoasts and lurex flares and get down breakdancing in
gold platform trainers. Music For Body Lockers is slick rick body
popping too fonky! Current release: Spaghettification & Music for Body
Lockers

NEOTROPIC - If the tone of today's testosterone tunes leaves ya a trifle
cold, feel the beat of female heat in regions neotropical. Riz Maslen is
Neotropic. Having also recorded under the pseudonym "Small Fish With
Spine" Riz's electronic landscapes is a welcome antidote to the world of
too many boyz making too much noise. Current release: 15 Levels Of
Magnification

HEXSTATIC - VJing is doing with visuals what a DJ does with music,
attempting to take the audio excitement that a good club DJ/sound system
provides, and ramp up the audiences' visual stimulation to an equal
energy level. In 1993 Hex started melding people's minds at the now
legendary Telepathic Fish squat parties with Matt Black's (Coldcut)
punky vhs set-up. Stuart Warren-Hill (HexStatic) has been at the
forefront of developments in new computer techtainment. From the video
sampling eco-friendly game 'Top Banana', and 7 groundbreaking
interactive music CD+ releases, to art installations for 2 major
galleries, and promoting VJing as a club artform. Current release:
Timber - Enhanced CD collaboration with Coldcut

and look out for Andrew DJing in Chicago and Detroit.

>>>>>>>>Bits and pieces from around the globe>>>>>>>>
Tokyo, Japan>>>>>>>
The music scene in Japan is alive. One of the most popular clubs is the
LIQUID ROOM where it has the best quality sound system and movin'
dancefloor. Its located in Kabuki-cho, the Tokyo version 42nd Street.
Once a month a big event called "Drum N' Bass Session" is held there and
this month's DJs are Jonny L, Boymerang and Doc Scott. BLUE, the club
which UFO produces, has as special guest Rainer Truby from Compost
Records (Germany) DJing with Rapahel Sebbag (UFO). LOOP is one of my
favorite clubs in Aoyama. Small but cozy and House music is the
mainstream. This months guest will be DJ Q as well as Ashley Beedle.
MANIAC LOVE and VAL in Aoyama plus PSY in Shinjuku have afterhours for
those who just can't get enough. And dont forget at YELLOW once a month
UFO plays at their regular party JAZZIN'. This month's live guest is
Monday Michiru. She has just released "MERMAID" which includes a remix
by Master At Work. In Japan a new album by the king of folk-soul Terry
Callier will be released from Talkin' Loud on May 1st. Titled
"TIMEPEACE" is such a masterpiece. His outstanding voice will command
respect. Japanese edition includes a remix by 4hero.
>>>>>>from Kaori assistant to United Future Organization
The UFO unofficial HP is:
http://www.j-link.or.jp/~mayumi/index.html
Also, if you are one of the few people in this world who haven't heard
of the stylish jazz-hop trio United Future Organization, they have just
released their greatest hits album, "Now and Then - Years of Lightning,
Day of Drums 1990-1997." This album is available domestically in Japan
and as an import elsewhere on double CD and limited edition quadruple
vinyl. A future U.S. release is slated  for sometime during this summer.
This incredible album features classic original U.F.O. tracks and
remixes by some of the top producers in the world including: King Britt,
DJ Harvey, Nobukazu Takemura, the Ballistic Brothers, Fila Brazillia,
Kyoto Jazz Massive, Demus, Forest Mighty Black, Ken Ishi and U.F.O.
themselves. They will be entering the studio soon to produce their 4th
album which is scheduled for release in the fall. U.F.O. have also just
released a cool limited edition spy watch thru Casio(Japan) designed by
none other than the infamous Tomato design group out of London. Tomato
has been responsible for some of the recent U.F.O. 12" album covers.
Tomato will be a participant at the FUSE98 Beyond Typography conference
in San Francisco in late May. One last thing, look out for the new issue
of the ever so hip Bar-f-Out! Magazine published by the Cool Resistants
Council. April issue number 32 features a fashion special with Comme des
Garcons.

Munich, Germany>>>>>> 
BEANFIELD have contributed an exclusive track to the "A Tribute To Lara
Croft CD (Tomb Raider virtual girl Lara Croft), features Depeche Mode,
Faith No More, Megashira, Apollo 440, Moby, Jimi Tenor, Yello,
Underworld, Aphex Twin and Gary Numan.
FAUNA FLASH  - The follow-up to FAUNA FLASHs Aquarius LP will be a
remix EP with NATURAL HIGH PRODUCTIONS remixes and a new track. "At the
Movies" 12inch will be released on PESHAYs ELEMENTZ
label.                                                                 
RAINER TRBY TRIO - New release on COMPOST in May. First 12inch will be
featuring a remix from the one and only PETER KRUDER (KRUDER &
DORFMEISTER)! 
MOVE D - New Remix 2-Ep from Heidelbergs SOURCE RECORDS Move D with
remixes from Morgan Geist (Clear), Elektronische Wohlfahrt (Berlin),
Bedouin Ascent (U.K.) + new Move D track.
FUNKSTRUNG - Abstract electro FUNKSTRUNG will release a 4- track EP
called Sonderdienste with new album finished in may or june.
NATURAL HIGH PRODUCTIONS - They are becoming Swizerlands most in-demand
export-good and are currently releasing new material on Photeks new
label.
FORCE & PAUL - Drum & bass wise FORCE & PAULs second 12inch release
will feature some deep vocals from BAIJKA.

and ph#/fax#. If you would like to be removed from our email
announcements please hit the return button at the top of this email and
respond inside the message (NOT IN THE SUBJECT LINE) with remove me
please. No problem. If you receive more than one email announcement
please let us know.This announcement is to inform you about upcoming
events and global info. You can send us information about what is going
on in your area, record label, top ten charts, etc...we will try to post
it. Please pass this email on to someone who you think might be
interested in these events and information. Again, thanks for your
support.  .8

Precedence: bulk

Place and time: somewhere in the Soviet Union in the 1930s.

The phone rings at KGB headquarters.
"Hello?"
"My neighbor Yankel Rabinovitz is an enemy of the State.  He is hiding
undeclared diamonds in his woodshed."
"This will be noted."

The next day, the KGB goons go over to Rabinovitz's house. They search the
shed where the firewood is kept, break every piece of wood, find no
diamonds, swear at Rabinovitz, and leave.

The phone rings at Rabinovitz's house.
"Hello, Yankel! Did the KGB come?"
"Yes."
"Did they chop your firewood?"
"Yes, they did."
"Okay, now it's your turn to call. I need my vegetable patch plowed."

--------------------------------

>KINDNESS, n. [1] a language that the dumb can speak and the deaf canhear.

	><{{{">   <"}}}><

		foolish fish

-----Original Message-----
From:	messiah wannabe [SMTP:messiahw@yahoo.com]
Sent:	Thursday, April 02, 1998 5:26 PM
To:	etraver@ix.netcom.com; Starchild
Cc:	sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject:	Re: NRR: Crash Worship?



due to interest on the list, i am reposting an old review of a crash
worship show i saw last year in oakland.  btw, tonight they are doing
another show, for women only ("crash worship asks that only women
attend this show...")  wish i could go, it should be interesting - cw
tends to take a theme and run with it...




crash worship review - thanksgiving day, '97
--------------------------------------------

after seemingly endless misadventures, chris, martha stewart, pjfuzzy
and myself finally made it to the warehouse at 2nd and jackson, only
to wait about 3 hours for cw to start playing.  beyond race was making
swirly arabian/ambient shadow music while a dj spun in the other room.
 then some slacker with a distorted acoustic guitar made beckish
beefhearty skronking noises for a while (normally i dislike anything
that smacks of indie rock but i had to admit the guy was rather
entertaining, whoever he was). i listened and danced till finally at
3:13 am crash worship stormed the warehouse.  wow.  how can you
possibly describe a crash worship show?

dozens of torches were lit to drum swells and the germano-yiddish
strains of a string trio.  topless dancers spun flaming batons as
platters of semi-clad girls were hoisted around the warehouse.  a
woman standing next to me whistled a long drone along with the
violins, i accompanied her by whistling an indian melody as the dozen
drumers softly banged their way through the crowd...  a 6 foot tall
man with flaming horns threw handfuls of firecrackers into the masses,
dousing the floor and audience with flammible liquids before burning
his hat in a flaming pyre that mushroomed up to the wooden rafters. 
then things started to get crazy...

the drum core beat a furious tattoo as the mosh pit started to
writhe... band members wandered through the crowd with mylar sacks of
red franzia, soaking the crowd in dyonesian revelry.  wine drenched
shirts came off...  celebrating the harvest season, i scarfed half of
a "special" cigarette with pj, then passed it off into the swirling
masses...  the same platters that held the half-naked women now held
fruit and spit-roasted suckling pigs.  the element of danger added a
keen edge to my high - an orange hit me on the side of the face,
stinging my eye - what if that had been one of the bottle rockets the
guy with the horns was shooting into the oil soaked crowd?  a
beautiful woman did acrobatics hanging from a rope attached to the
ceiling as the strings lilted.  the drummers beat louder and faster as
she spun and spun and spun...  the tempo picked up again, those guys
could make a pretty phat beat when they put their minds to it, i was
sucked into the crowd once again...  a semi-neud couple necked in the
middle of it all, i lightly caressed them as i floated by, they didn't
seem to mind...  louder, faster, louder, louder, my ears were
splitting as the whole scene built to a crazy creshendo till suddenly
at 4:23 the cops busted in and shut off the sound system.  but of
course that couldn't stop the drummers, who continued to wander
through the crowd beating furiously as the police tried to chase them
down.  meanwhile the string quartet was now being pushed through the
crowd by naked men on a viking ship with wheels as they handed out
grapes to the revelers and the beautiful woman had stripped off her
fishnets and was doing more erotic ballet hanging from another spot on
the ceiling...  the five cops and ten security guys were still trying
to get the 400 or so people out the door, they were arguing with the
drummers, who (practically at gunpoint) led a bunch of us out the door
and onto the street, where they continued to play and dance till 4:36
am - one hour and 23 minutes later.


funny thing about crash worship - the first time i saw them they did
the same show (minus circus acts and pigs) to 13 people in a small
club in raliegh n.c. one wednesday.  my roomate knew one of the band
members from art school, so we invited them to stay the night at our
20's farmhouse in bynum (pop 223).  ALL RIGHT, i thought, THE PLACE IS
GONNA GET TRASHED!  COOL!  you can imagine my (pleasant?) surprise
when, upon their arrival at our house, their drummer dreike made
herbal tea for everyone while chit-chatting with me and my wife, and
then they all went promptly to sleep - but not before washing out all
their mugs and placing them neatly to dry on the dishrack.  _very_
nice people...

-messiah wannabe

>though, if they were disposable, that it would be a good idea.

        Well, I had yellow ski goggles on my forehead and was also wearing
a silver rain jacket over the jumpsuit when I arrived.  Later on I had the
jumpsuit unzipped down the front and my body smeared with some of that
cancer-causing silver glitter (good one Monty, I actually forwarded that
post to someone thinking you were in earnest before I thought twice and
realized I'd been had!)

        I don't know if the jumpsuit was DuPont or not, it doesn't have any
labels on the outside that I've ever noticed, and as far as who made it, I
doubt I could answer that question about hardly anything in my closet.  I
don't think it was designed to be disposable, but if bleach doesn't do the
trick I may be disposing of it soon.

have you given any thought to the size of a cd-quality mp3 of
a DJ spinning for any decent amount of time?  You're looking
at something like 1Minute = 1Meg.

45+Meg mp3 files are probably going to be a pain for most
people to download.  even on a T1/T3 it would be annoying.

just a though...

Trust me, this is essential viewing for everyone.

>One deals with how individuals, groups and government interact 
>(read: politics) and the other deals with the distribution of wealth 
>(read: economics). 
>

...OK, but if I steal your shit and give it to the somebody else, then I am
contravening the boundaries of the two concepts you posit...

groups and government interact", and it breaks the law, too.>

...is theft an economic act? <well yes, cause I redistribute resources and
especially yes if i profit from your stuff >

something tells me the issue is a little deeper here...

At 12:03 PM 4/3/98 -0800, Mook wrote:
>Before I take off from work to pick up a freind in LA and come back anybody
>got a review of Brian's set that he spun last Wednesday??
> ;)

I'll give a review :)  The DJ booth was way up off the dance floor, so
there was *no* interaction potential, strike one.  Strike two: the band had
just ended their set, and it being 1am and a weeknight, everyone had this
bleary look in their eyes, and I could just hear half the crowd say to
their other half, "gee, I wonder how many messages I've got in my inbox
this evening...".  The fact that they shut the bar down didn't help :)
Strike three.  So given those circumstances I'd venture I played an OK set;
I didn't haul out anything fancy, just used the club's Gemeni CD players,
so no fancy warping of the sound either.  So this was a glorified "play a
few toons I like for some friends" gig, beyond anything else.  I saw a few
dozen folks left writhing around to the music so I guess it was liked by
those who stayed.

Markie spun a great set in the same room, and kept it packed in between the
band's two sets.  The man is *such* a professional.  Rocky (caliban) played
a nice trippy set before the band's first set, too - anyone catch him last
night on KZSU closing out the "day of noise"?

	Brian

>The UCSF doctors have told us she will die if a bone marrow donor is
not

marrow.

>half-Asian or Asian descent have the greatest chance of matching, but
>anyone could be a match.

>You could be the one person to save Sachi's life.  Please register as a
>donor at one of the drives listed (http://www.definingmoment.com/). 
You
>will make a world of difference in not only Sachi's life, but the
lives of
>the people who care about her as well.

I was in the 'main' room, waiting until 1:30pm, for Brian to start.  I
figured he'd be much better than the wanker playing bad industro-pop/big
beat there.

1:30 came and went, no brian...so I started to wander...and then found him
just before he finished in the 'live band' room...I didn't even know there
were dj's in there.  A nice little drum'n'bass track was playing...ah,
much better.  The red lights on the mirror ball were very 60's lounge-ish.
Then he played some way slow shuffle track, let loose a puff of smoke from
the fog-hog, and stopped.  bummer.

I was the guy with almost no-hair lurking in the green jacket at the foot
of the stage.  I woulda come up and said howdy, but you looked like you'd
rather not be disturbed by some wanker from the sfraves list.  ;)

-jimg



On Fri, 3 Apr 1998, Brian Behlendorf wrote:

> At 12:03 PM 4/3/98 -0800, Mook wrote:
> >Before I take off from work to pick up a freind in LA and come back anybody
> >got a review of Brian's set that he spun last Wednesday??
> > ;)
> 
> I'll give a review :)  The DJ booth was way up off the dance floor, so
> there was *no* interaction potential, strike one.  Strike two: the band had
> just ended their set, and it being 1am and a weeknight, everyone had this
> bleary look in their eyes, and I could just hear half the crowd say to
> their other half, "gee, I wonder how many messages I've got in my inbox
> this evening...".  The fact that they shut the bar down didn't help :)
> Strike three.  So given those circumstances I'd venture I played an OK set;
> I didn't haul out anything fancy, just used the club's Gemeni CD players,
> so no fancy warping of the sound either.  So this was a glorified "play a
> few toons I like for some friends" gig, beyond anything else.  I saw a few
> dozen folks left writhing around to the music so I guess it was liked by
> those who stayed.
> 
> Markie spun a great set in the same room, and kept it packed in between the
> band's two sets.  The man is *such* a professional.  Rocky (caliban) played
> a nice trippy set before the band's first set, too - anyone catch him last
> night on KZSU closing out the "day of noise"?

From sfraves-owner-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sat Apr 04 01:17:59 1998

Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 21879 invoked by uid 6000); 4 Apr 1998 01:17:57 -0000
Received: (qmail 21870 invoked from network); 4 Apr 1998 01:17:56 -0000
Received: from netcom8.netcom.com (mayer@192.100.81.117)
  by taz.hyperreal.org with SMTP; 4 Apr 1998 01:17:56 -0000
Received: from localhost (mayer@localhost)
	by netcom8.netcom.com (8.8.5-r-beta/8.8.5/(NETCOM v1.02)) with SMTP id RAA14604;
	Fri, 3 Apr 1998 17:17:54 -0800 (PST)
Message-Id: <199804040117.RAA14604@netcom8.netcom.com>
X-Authentication-Warning: netcom8.netcom.com: mayer@localhost didn't use HELO protocol
To: "San FranDisco Ravers List" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>,
  groovi-music@netcom.com
Subject: Fave Mix CD of the Month
Date: Fri, 03 Apr 98 17:17:54 -0800
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


from the "DJ Kicks" series from Studio!K7 -- Smith and Mighty

A very broad ranging mix ranging from some of those classic '89
"Bristol Soul Sound" to brit-trip-hip-hop, to dub, to drum and bass...
I've been into the Smith and Mighty sound ever since my trip to bristol
in '89 (I used to work at HP, so I got to visit HP bristol for work...
and check out their scene at night...). Other than Smith and Mighty's
"Bass is Maternal" and major record label push for groups like Massive
Attack and Tricky, I really haven't seen any releases whatsoever with
that bristol sound I like.

Well, this one has a nice mix of them, and it's a nice mix. 

It's so nice to hear a mix that isn't just straight up same-tempo, same
sound, boom boom boom boom (for house), or straight-up same-temp
bo-chk-chk-chk-fuzzz-fuzzz-bwaaaaa-bwaaaaa-bwaaaaa of jungle. This one
mixes it up with niceness, if ya know wha' I mean.

 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==>> Niels Mayer (mayer@netcom.com) <<>> http://www.cybertribe.com/mayer <<==
 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

From: Noah Apodaca <unclenoa@netcom.com>
Subject: Re: NRR: Two types of socialism
To: "Ravers 'Round the Bay" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <3.0.1.32.19980404002247.006a5710@mail.u-net.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.3.89.9804032035.A2437-0100000@netcom16>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

source:  Webster's New World Dictionary, 1990 edition, Warner Books p 122 
& 560


communism:  any theory or system of common ownership of property

socialism:  a theory by which the means of production and distribution 
are owned by society rather than by individuals


> ...OK, but if I steal your shit and give it to the somebody else, then I am
> contravening the boundaries of the two concepts you posit...

No, in a communist system, for example, you couldn't steal my shit.  I 
couldn't steal your shit.  In fact, nobody could steal anybody's shit 
because nobody has any shit.  All the shit that we have belongs to all of 
us as a group and to none of us as individuals.  You wouldn't be 
stealing, you'd just be moving shit from place to place.  I see no 
contravention here.  :)


> 
> ...so, is theft a political act? <well yes, it "deals with how individuals,
> groups and government interact", and it breaks the law, too.>
> 

larceny:  the unlawful taking of another's property (IBID p 333)

Larceny is a criminal act.  I thas nothing to do with politics.  But in 
a society that does not recognize private ownership of property, larceny, 
by definition, could not exist.

> ...is theft an economic act? <well yes, cause I redistribute resources and
> especially yes if i profit from your stuff >

You can only profit if there is gain in the trade of goods or services.  
In a system of group ownership of property, you could try day and night to sell 
something and you'd never get a buyer because if someone really wanted 
that item, all they'd have to do is come and get it and use it.


:)

PLUR

the heat was once again to a deadly degree :P oh well... Met some
peepole LACIE being one and my friend Mike who went out of his way to
give me a ride all the way home, Thanks Mike(sorry bout forcing you to
listen to my Gabber!!!) and suprisingly people I know from when I went
to school. THERE IS SOMEONE THAT I NEVER SAW AND YOU KNOW WHO YOU ARE :)

could say.... I got my gabber :P Well all in all the night was good...
hot but ok...

Message-ID: <19980405221704.19949.qmail@hotmail.com>
Received: from 206.14.7.161 by www.hotmail.com with HTTP;
	Sun, 05 Apr 1998 15:17:04 PDT
X-Originating-IP: [206.14.7.161]
From: "kid digs" <kid_digs@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org, dreamer@ziplink.net
Cc: TeKnODiVa@aol.com
Subject: Re: Crash Worship review
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Sun, 05 Apr 1998 15:17:04 PDT
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Hi i'm kind of new on thislist but i just wanted to put my couple of 
centz in on crashworship and all that.  First of all i would say if you 
really want to get into one of their shows it is much better at the 
location they usually play at on 2nd st. in Oakland.  That place is a 
big ol' abandoned warehouse with two rooms, and one room has a more ravy 
trance-house atmosphere while the other one has the more tribal 
fire-eating atmosphere.  For a raver the Oakland location would be 
better and probably for anyone else also.  I feel like at the maritime 
there were more 'rules', whereas at the warehouse things were freer.

  Even so I had so much fun at this show and pretty much forgot my mind 
and name with no drugs.  Somewhere I read that if you learn the path to 
the lsd or the shroom state you can find your way back again without the 
aid of the drug.  I felt like the music and the collective consciousness 
did that for me.  It was a moment of pure satanic joy.
You stop and listen in the middle of the show and the vocals sound so 
insane like the roar of a dinosoar or the silver scream of an elephant 
from outer space.  

  As far as what starchild was sayin' bout sexism, I guess I could 
understand that but I didn't really see anything unconsensual going on.  
It's human nature i think.  I've been making a project of photographing 
their shows and got a couple shots with a real positive feel this time.  

latah,

             digs

that i thought some of you might be interested in exploring.

like something at least worth trying for anyone interested
in world peace or spirituality. I am not connected with this

>Subject: Press Release: The Great Experiment

http://www.peaceseeds.com  

The Great Experiment
>
>Join us in what could be a decisive moment in the evolution of humanity.
Tell >everyone you know, and mark your calender to participate in the
largest, most >focused, meditation in the history of the world.
>
>Here's the Question:
>
>Can millions of people, focusing their minds on inner and world peace,heal >the world in an instant?  Can we, through scientific and 
quantifiable
means, >prove that we are indeed the creators of the world we perceive, 
and
that by >changing our perception, the world itself changes?
>
>This is "The Great Experiment."  It's time we prove scientifically whatthe >saints and sages have always told us  that we are powerful 
spiritual
beings >with the ability to create a world based on the laws of love,
instead of the >rules of fear.  With the help of scientists, we are 
about
to put an end to >doubt forever.
>

It was a pretty good party.  I had a lot of fun.  Of course I was
completely out of my mind due to some candEE I had at the party.  This
candEE was pretty kosher.  Too bad you can't find this candEE at liquor
stores or snackbars.  N E Ways, I enjoyed the music and the small
setting.  Prime stuff.  It was cool also 'cause it was my first Trance
and Jungle Factory party.  I'm so used to shopping there but I have never
partied there.  Boomerang came through with a lovely ambient set and some
good literature to go along with it.  Man, that guy has some nutty
stories.  It kinda sucked however since some dickhead was stealing shit. 
Apparently, somebody ganked a 1200 also.  That's fucked up.  Thomas does
a lot for the scene and people are here not even aware and just fucking
it up for everybody else.  It was good seeing all the familiar faces that
I met........ya'll know who you are so I'm not going to strain my brain
remembering who.

Well, I guess that little spiel of mine about not partying was once again
wrong.  So for future reference........fuck it, I'm always going to
party, maybe not all the time but atleast every so often.

C U all at the Viberation party.

Drekster

From: Dsfunshnl1 <Dsfunshnl1@aol.com>
Message-ID: <f6d213b.35287a0d@aol.com>
Date: Mon, 6 Apr 1998 02:45:31 EDT
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Mime-Version: 1.0
Subject: <<BIONIC DRAMA!!!>>  please read... (need advice)
Content-type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 3.0 16-bit for Windows sub 38
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Hey everyone... 
     I am embarassed to even talk about this... but it's not just something
that's affecting me... it's something that's affecting some of my friends in
the scene too... so I'm asking you for some advice on how to deal with this
little drama thing that's going on with me lately...
     First of all... there's a girl in the scene that I used to date.  Things
didn't work out... and we didn't part on the best of terms.  No big deal,
right..?  I mean, it happens to everyone sometime in their life.  O.K.  So I
haven't talked to this girl since October... I have seen her at a few parties
lately... (The Gathering, Harmony, Skillz, skillz afterparty, Tranceforce, and
last night at Bionic...).  Though I regret that she and I aren't friends now,
I accept that it's her choice, and I respect her wishes.  The times I've seen
her at parties, I haven't tried to talk to her.  I haven't approached her. I
haven't followed her.  I don't look at her.  In short, I respect her.  The
last thing I would ever do is try to bring a bad vibe into the scene which has
shown me much love and a feeling of community.  A sense of belonging...  When
she sees me at a party, if she's dancing and sees me, she looks at me with
evil eyes.  I look away.  If I walk into a room where she's just chilling...
she will bail.  At first, that reaction toward me really bothered me because
I've never in my life had such a negative reaction towards my "existence".
But I've come to accept that it's just the way it is and I don't let it bother
me anymore.  I've talked to some of you about this drama before and everyone's
agreed that it sucks, but what else can you say...!  I feel the same way.
     But for some reason, I guess the fact that I don't do any of those things
I mentioned isn't enough for her.  For last night, she was at Bionic and had
brought many of her friends with her.  (As this post has already gone long....
I will sum up some of the events that took place....)
1.  her little brother (age 13...) and another guy were <always..> right
behind me when I was dancing... and I caught them both kicking empty water
bottles toward me while I was dancing... whenever I would move somewhere else,
sooner or later, they were there too. <my guess is to try and make me trip on
the bottles>
2.  I was giving a friend a back rub in the chill area... and another one of
her friends came by and took a picture of that.  my friend is alot younger
than I am... and I've known her since january.  <my guess is that a picture is
soon to appear at a party near you... flaming me or something....>
3.  another guy was following me all night.  at first I thought I was
tripping... but I wasn't on anything hallucinagenic, so you be the judge...
and once when I went from the main room to the jungle room, this guy walked
through the room looking left and right for someone.  he passed me without
noticing me, so I followed him.  when he got to the end of the room and turned
around, it startled him to see that I was following about 15 feet behind.
<the shocked look on his face confirmed my suspicions...>
4.  I went with a couple of friends from the list into the chill area to relax
a little and I noticed one of her friends talking to a security guy.  <why am
I noticing these things you ask?  because weird things had been happening all
night!> he then made 3 trips to the chill area checking things out.  the first
two times he just came and left.  but the third time, he walked to the cyclone
gate and let himself into the "off limits" area but didn't close the door
completely.  he kept poking his head out looking toward me, but when he would
see me looking back, he would step back.  then he would look again.  finally,
he just kept staring... so I approached him and started up a conversation.
during our conversation, he asked me things like "what time did I get
there..?", "who did I know there..?", "did I come with anybody..?", and "did I
come with the people I was sitting down with..?".  <I don't know what her
friend said to him, but it was obvious that he was there because of me. but I
am not! a dealer, and have not EVER harrassed anyone at a party!  ....or ever,
for that matter....>
5.  while I was talking to some other friends on the list who were on the
dance floor, one of her friends walked by and spit something out of her mouth
onto my female friend's back.  I yelled at her but she kept walking.  <this
whole drama has now reached a new low....>
6.  toward the end of the party, I separated myself from my friends because if
someone has a problem with me, IT STAYS WITH ME!!!  I don't want anybody to
suffer as a result of (my...) personal problems.  <but as I was sitting at the
tables near the front entrance to the party, I noticed 3 security personnel
just staring at me.  my returned stares did not stop them from staring.  and
some of the people who I'd encountered during the evening had also stopped
near the exit and were staring at me.  at this point, as dramatic as this may
seem, I feared for my personal safety and asked another friend from the list
(rather intimidating in size...) to walk out with me.  I did  not tell him
about the drama, but only wanted a show of support...>
**Now.... I've met many of you peeps and have made some really great friends.
Those of you who know me I trust will have a VERY favorable thought in regards
to me.  And for those of you who don't know me... let me tell you this:  my
screen name refers only to a play on the word dysfunctional and refers to my
having been brought up in an alcoholic, 2-marriage family.  I do not, however
use my upbringing as an excuse for ANYTHING!  In fact, I use it as a stimulus
to achieve more out of life.  The results thus far include: I am a supervisor
for a contract manufacturing machine shop in Hayward, I own my own home and a
cabin in Tahoe, and have completed 6 years of post-secondary education.  I am
in fact still continuing my education.  
     While I don't look for any recognition for anything I do... for the
benefit of those who have not met me, I will tell you that I have gone out of
my way to pick up people for a party, returned them home (or others who didn't
have a ride...), payed for some to go to a party, helped with setting up
and/or tearing down at a party, and I've never... ever!  tried to "pick up" on
anybody at a party.  I feel I contribute positively to the scene which has
shown me such a feeling of belonging, but as I type this post, I'm wondering
if my being involved in the scene is a bad thing because I do not want to
bring any negativity into it.  (My sister always told me I'm too sensitive for
my own good... but I've shed tears over this whole drama... and I'm really
asking for some advice on how to deal with it.  In short, I guess I'm putting
it into your hands.  So please advise).
Thank you in advance for your suggestions...
Peace. Out.
~Michael

Hey Mike,

Eventhough I heard all of this, reading it and thinking about it a
second time made me think of the situation more. Bro you have my full
support.... some people dwell on the past and thrive on making others
uneasy in an area that they are sharing. She obviously has some problems
that she needs to take care of and the way she is treating you is
completely uncalled for. I think her age may have another affect, she
hasn't lived and learned enough to understand herself. It's kinda sad
that she would resort to these kinds of childish games and that really
dissapoints me that anyone would act that way... I think she needs to
move on and live her life instead of trying to make you feel any nervous
feelings about being in a place with her. Eventhough I've only known you
for a little over 2 months now, you are a great friend to me and I know
for a fact that you don't deserve to be treated this way by ANYONE, and
I know it's not something you can really just forget about and let be
because it would bother me too. In time hopefully she will grow out of
this childish behavior...... And I'm here if ya ever need me bro. See ya
at Vibration : )

> didn't work out... and we didn't part on the best of terms.  No big deal,

Mike,

Man I feel for you, I really do.  But PLEASE do not even think of dropping out
of the scene because of of someone else.  I know we don't know eachother but
just from reading your letter you sound like a really cool person with alot of
positive energy to contribute.  Speaking as a once very immature girl myself i
can tell you that this girl is just playing stupid games due to some bad
feelings that she's experiencing from this whole situation.  Maybe she wanted
you to chase after her or some stupid shit like that but you didn't so now
she's just tring to make your life a living hell.  Whatever the case may be
she is in need of some serious help.  My sugestion would be to just confront
her and try and resolve this manner in a civilized fashion, instead of just
trying to ignore the situatuion by leaving the scene, because beleive me your
positive energy will surely be missed by all those who love you and all those
out there waiting to feel you love and positive energy.  So please try not to
let this situation get you too down but rather face it head on, who knows
maybe you guys can become friends?!!

-L.M.

>From www.drudgereport.com

INTENSE 'FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS' SCREENING HAD SOME IN
AUDIENCE LOOKING FOR EXIT

UNIVERSAL sneaked its movie FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS Tuesday
night in North Hollywood. Being described as "one of the most bizarre
films ever made," the Terry Gilliam project based on a Hunter Thompson
took them to hell and didn't let them come back during its 2 hour
screening.

"I got sick afterwards," one attendee told the DRUDGE REPORT. "Like
they laced my popcorn with angel dust or something."

Thompson's 1971 fuss-novel hits the screen after literally 25 years in
development and 17 different scripts. Names like Nicholson, Scorsese,
John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd have been attached over the years. The
story follows the adventures of a ROLLING STONE magazine writer
[Johnny Depp] who is sent to Las Vegas to cover a Narcotics
Enforcement convention. Dark Comedy.

No sex, very little violence, it was scenes of graphic drug-tripping
-- scenes that make the TRAINSPOTTING boys look like aspirin chewers
-- that shocked the crowd and had some looking for exit.

One scene that goes down in a Casino has Depp hallucinating lizards.

The 10 minute scene comes early in the film and sets tone. "He's in
this Casino and all of a sudden every one in it starts to turn into
creepy lizard-like creatures," describes a viewer. "Very disturbing...
wacky."

Depp smokes a cigarillo throughout the film making his continuous drug
rants even more over the top, at times reducing him to nothing more
than a mumble. "Whenthegoinggetsweird, t h e weird turn pro," or
something like that. Depp acts out ether binges, coke tokes, LSD
attacks with surprising ease. Camera effects simulate the highs for
the viewer.

One extended exchange between Depp and his attorney, who is tripping
out hard in a bathtub, was so intense and disturbing that several in
the screening audience walked out of the theater. [More than a dozen
found exit during the film, according to one estimate.]

The drink and drug road trip of writer Depp and his attorney is set
for release in late May. Just how a new generation will relate to
Thompson's "Savage Journey to the Heart of the American Dream" is an
open question at UNIVERSAL. One executive hints that Depp's Hawaiian
shirt may become a fashion trend. The movie's soundtrack, said to
feature 70's lounge, may also start something.

she knows she has done something wrong and in order for her to accept

>lately... (The Gathering, Harmony, Skillz, skillz afterparty,

>last night at Bionic...).  Though I regret that she and I aren't 
>friends now,
>I accept that it's her choice, and I respect her wishes.  The times 
>I've seen
>her at parties, I haven't tried to talk to her.  I haven't approached 
>her. I
>haven't followed her.  I don't look at her.  In short, I respect her.  
>The
>last thing I would ever do is try to bring a bad vibe into the scene 
>which has
>shown me much love and a feeling of community.  A sense of 
>belonging...  When
>she sees me at a party, if she's dancing and sees me, she looks at me 
>with
>evil eyes.  I look away.  If I walk into a room where she's just 
>chilling...
>she will bail.  At first, that reaction toward me really bothered me 
>because
>I've never in my life had such a negative reaction towards my 
>"existence".
>But I've come to accept that it's just the way it is and I don't let 
>it bother
>me anymore.  I've talked to some of you about this drama before and 
>everyone's
>agreed that it sucks, but what else can you say...!  I feel the same 
>way.
>     But for some reason, I guess the fact that I don't do any of 
>those things
>I mentioned isn't enough for her.  For last night, she was at Bionic 
>and had
>brought many of her friends with her.  (As this post has already gone 
>long....
>I will sum up some of the events that took place....)
>1.  her little brother (age 13...) and another guy were <always..> 
>right
>behind me when I was dancing... and I caught them both kicking empty 
>water
>bottles toward me while I was dancing... whenever I would move 
>somewhere else,
>sooner or later, they were there too. <my guess is to try and make me 
>trip on
>the bottles>
>2.  I was giving a friend a back rub in the chill area... and another 
>one of
>her friends came by and took a picture of that.  my friend is alot 
>younger
>than I am... and I've known her since january.  <my guess is that a 
>picture is
>soon to appear at a party near you... flaming me or something....>
>3.  another guy was following me all night.  at first I thought I was
>tripping... but I wasn't on anything hallucinagenic, so you be the 
>judge...
>and once when I went from the main room to the jungle room, this guy 
>walked
>through the room looking left and right for someone.  he passed me 
>without
>noticing me, so I followed him.  when he got to the end of the room 
>and turned
>around, it startled him to see that I was following about 15 feet 
>behind.
><the shocked look on his face confirmed my suspicions...>
>4.  I went with a couple of friends from the list into the chill area 
>to relax
>a little and I noticed one of her friends talking to a security guy.  
><why am
>I noticing these things you ask?  because weird things had been 
>happening all
>night!> he then made 3 trips to the chill area checking things out.  
>the first
>two times he just came and left.  but the third time, he walked to the 
>cyclone
>gate and let himself into the "off limits" area but didn't close the 
>door
>completely.  he kept poking his head out looking toward me, but when 
>he would
>see me looking back, he would step back.  then he would look again.  
>finally,
>he just kept staring... so I approached him and started up a 
>conversation.
>during our conversation, he asked me things like "what time did I get
>there..?", "who did I know there..?", "did I come with anybody..?", 
>and "did I
>come with the people I was sitting down with..?".  <I don't know what 
>her
>friend said to him, but it was obvious that he was there because of 
>me. but I
>am not! a dealer, and have not EVER harrassed anyone at a party!  
>....or ever,
>for that matter....>
>5.  while I was talking to some other friends on the list who were on 
>the
>dance floor, one of her friends walked by and spit something out of 
>her mouth
>onto my female friend's back.  I yelled at her but she kept walking.  
><this
>whole drama has now reached a new low....>
>6.  toward the end of the party, I separated myself from my friends 
>because if
>someone has a problem with me, IT STAYS WITH ME!!!  I don't want 
>anybody to
>suffer as a result of (my...) personal problems.  <but as I was 
>sitting at the
>tables near the front entrance to the party, I noticed 3 security 
>personnel
>just staring at me.  my returned stares did not stop them from 
>staring.  and
>some of the people who I'd encountered during the evening had also 
>stopped
>near the exit and were staring at me.  at this point, as dramatic as 
>this may
>seem, I feared for my personal safety and asked another friend from 
>the list
>(rather intimidating in size...) to walk out with me.  I did  not tell 
>him
>about the drama, but only wanted a show of support...>
>**Now.... I've met many of you peeps and have made some really great 
>friends.
>Those of you who know me I trust will have a VERY favorable thought in 
>regards
>to me.  And for those of you who don't know me... let me tell you 
>this:  my
>screen name refers only to a play on the word dysfunctional and refers 
>to my
>having been brought up in an alcoholic, 2-marriage family.  I do not, 
>however
>use my upbringing as an excuse for ANYTHING!  In fact, I use it as a 
>stimulus
>to achieve more out of life.  The results thus far include: I am a 
>supervisor
>for a contract manufacturing machine shop in Hayward, I own my own 
>home and a
>cabin in Tahoe, and have completed 6 years of post-secondary 
>education.  I am
>in fact still continuing my education.  
>     While I don't look for any recognition for anything I do... for 
>the
>benefit of those who have not met me, I will tell you that I have gone 
>out of
>my way to pick up people for a party, returned them home (or others 
>who didn't
>have a ride...), payed for some to go to a party, helped with setting 
>up
>and/or tearing down at a party, and I've never... ever!  tried to 
>"pick up" on
>anybody at a party.  I feel I contribute positively to the scene which 
>has
>shown me such a feeling of belonging, but as I type this post, I'm 
>wondering
>if my being involved in the scene is a bad thing because I do not want 
>to
>bring any negativity into it.  (My sister always told me I'm too 
>sensitive for
>my own good... but I've shed tears over this whole drama... and I'm 
>really
>asking for some advice on how to deal with it.  In short, I guess I'm 
>putting
>it into your hands.  So please advise).
>Thank you in advance for your suggestions...
>Peace. Out.
>~Michael

VW certainly has done their research to target their audience.

The songs I've recognized in ads:

Orb - Little Fluffy Clouds
Stereolab - Parsec
Spiritualized - Ladies & gentlemen we are floating in space
	(which caused a minor flashback last night!)

And another song I don't recognize.

What is up with that?  The Stereolab and Spiritualized songs
are relatively new, which makes me wonder if they had these
deals lined up even before the albums were released.

Does this scare anyone else at all, just a little bit?

Steve.

>And another song I don't recognize.
>
>What is up with that?  The Stereolab and Spiritualized songs
>are relatively new, which makes me wonder if they had these
>deals lined up even before the albums were released.

 a lot of music works this way with the film & tv industry.  if you watch
The Saint, which came out well over a year ago, there's a scene in the
train station where a 3-second cut of that Daft Punk hit is playing  verrry
quietly in the background.    i don't know when the album was released in
the US, but it was a long time between the time the film came out and radio
started playing the song.

also, remember that a lot of stuff is released overseas a long time before
american culture catches it.  an example is how  Macarena  was a hit in
Mexico & South America like 5 or 6 years before it  revolutionalized
drunken sports revelry in the States.


~~~~~~)

-----Original Message-----
From:	steve [SMTP:sbrocksieck@compare.net]
Sent:	Monday, April 06, 1998 10:23 AM
To:	SFRaves; Cole Berggren; Jeff Schumann; Lara Thurman
Subject:	VW is so freaking hip . . .

VW certainly has done their research to target their audience.

The songs I've recognized in ads:

Orb - Little Fluffy Clouds
Stereolab - Parsec
Spiritualized - Ladies & gentlemen we are floating in space
	(which caused a minor flashback last night!)

And another song I don't recognize.

What is up with that?  The Stereolab and Spiritualized songs
are relatively new, which makes me wonder if they had these
deals lined up even before the albums were released.

Does this scare anyone else at all, just a little bit?

Steve.

OOooooooooooooooooooh!  I can't funkin' wait for this movie to come out.  
This was such a great book.  I finished reading just as we were driving 
into Las Vegas in a rented convertible at sunset...however I was with my 
dad and we were looking at colleges (boring).  But Hunter Thompson is 
such a wacky fun guy.  I've read about parties at his cabin in COlorado.  

Plus, gotta see this lizard scene...Once, on my seventeenth birthday, my 
friends and I skipped school and spent the day in a park (in Boulder 
CO).  All day.  Morn to dusk. Watched the clouds and listened to Led 
Zeppelin for 9 hours.  'Somehow', I forgot to go to work that day too. 
Parents were worried.  I finally called, and Pop came to pick me up.  I 
opened the door of the Camry (which had no wheels-- rather, it was 
levitating like Luke's landspeeder (?) vehicle in the first Star Wars), 
looked in, and saw that my dad was a Lizard.  His forked tongue kept 
flicking out when he spoke.  I sat on the far edge of the seat as we 
flew home. 

Can't wait to see this funkin' movie!  Yeee-haw! 

Nathan


>Subject: FLIX - Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
>Date: Fri, 3 Apr 1998 13:03:12 -0600
>From: FringeWare News Network <email@fringeware.com>
>Sender: email@fringeware.com (FringeWare News Network)
>X-Www-Page: http://www.fringeware.com/msg/sub.html
>Reply-To: jim@smallworks.com, email@fringeware.com
>
>Sent from: Jim Thompson <jim@smallworks.com>
>
>>From www.drudgereport.com
>
>INTENSE 'FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS' SCREENING HAD SOME IN
>AUDIENCE LOOKING FOR EXIT
>
>UNIVERSAL sneaked its movie FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS Tuesday
>night in North Hollywood. Being described as "one of the most bizarre
>films ever made," the Terry Gilliam project based on a Hunter Thompson
>took them to hell and didn't let them come back during its 2 hour
>screening.
>
>"I got sick afterwards," one attendee told the DRUDGE REPORT. "Like
>they laced my popcorn with angel dust or something."
>
>Thompson's 1971 fuss-novel hits the screen after literally 25 years in
>development and 17 different scripts. Names like Nicholson, Scorsese,
>John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd have been attached over the years. The
>story follows the adventures of a ROLLING STONE magazine writer
>[Johnny Depp] who is sent to Las Vegas to cover a Narcotics
>Enforcement convention. Dark Comedy.
>
>No sex, very little violence, it was scenes of graphic drug-tripping
>-- scenes that make the TRAINSPOTTING boys look like aspirin chewers
>-- that shocked the crowd and had some looking for exit.
>
>One scene that goes down in a Casino has Depp hallucinating lizards.
>
>The 10 minute scene comes early in the film and sets tone. "He's in
>this Casino and all of a sudden every one in it starts to turn into
>creepy lizard-like creatures," describes a viewer. "Very disturbing...
>wacky."
>
>Depp smokes a cigarillo throughout the film making his continuous drug
>rants even more over the top, at times reducing him to nothing more
>than a mumble. "Whenthegoinggetsweird, t h e weird turn pro," or
>something like that. Depp acts out ether binges, coke tokes, LSD
>attacks with surprising ease. Camera effects simulate the highs for
>the viewer.
>
>One extended exchange between Depp and his attorney, who is tripping
>out hard in a bathtub, was so intense and disturbing that several in
>the screening audience walked out of the theater. [More than a dozen
>found exit during the film, according to one estimate.]
>
>The drink and drug road trip of writer Depp and his attorney is set
>for release in late May. Just how a new generation will relate to
>Thompson's "Savage Journey to the Heart of the American Dream" is an
>open question at UNIVERSAL. One executive hints that Depp's Hawaiian
>shirt may become a fashion trend. The movie's soundtrack, said to
>feature 70's lounge, may also start something.
>

actually *are* people out there who seem to enjoy *creating* drama in 
their lives.  Perhaps this is her way of garnering attention from her 
friends or making herself seem important, like you are some stalker

drekster@juno.com (Derek J Fieldsoe) writes:
>You see, she is very immature 'cause
>she knows she has done something wrong and in order for her to accept
>herself, she has to try and make somebody else to do something wrong so
>she can feel better about herself.  I guess you can say that she's one of
>them sheep that feels wrong and bad if she does something that everybody
>else isn't doing.  She has no thoughts or her own and therefore shouldn't
>be worried about.

OK, so I get that Mike/Dsfunshnl requested some advice, and that you are
his friend and are trying to support him, and I think it's great that you
are doing that.

I caution you, though, about making statements like the one quoted above.
You really have no idea what is going on in this girl's head.  How do you
know that "she knows she has done something wrong"?  Perhaps she thinks
that Mike/Dsfunshnl is in the wrong and that she is entirely right.  It's
possible that she had a conversation with her friends that is almost
identical to the one that is going on here.  She says: "Mike/Dsfunshnl is
doing something I don't like."  Her friends say: "Yup, he's wrong, and
we'll side with you because you're our friend."  And the result is the
behavior that Mike/Dsfunshnl described.

If the girl thinks that she is right, then you saying that the girl is
wrong only exacerbates the situation because you're setting up
Mike/Dsfunshnl and his friends to start thinking in a way that isn't in
agreement with the actual situation.  She feels the way she feels, and
thinking that she is  wrong for feeling that way is like thinking that the
earth is wrong for having earthquakes.  Her friends are doing what they're
doing because they think they are supporting her, and I bet that they all
think they are doing the right thing.

I'm not saying that I think that what the girl or her friends are doing is
right, and I'm not saying that you need to think that it's right either.
But if you get that they think that they are right as much as you think you
are right, then you may be able to gain more insight into the situation
than if you just assume that they are wrong and are a bunch of mindless
sheep.

X-MSMail-Priority: Normal

Precedence: bulk


I have found myself in this situation multiple times it seems in my youth
on both sides of the fence.  And because of my youth probably is why I
allowed myself to become caught up in the drama regardless of the side I
was on.  I had not experienced anything such as this again until recently
in the rave scene.  Which might *possibly* be explained by the fact that I
had not been around the younger set (21 and under) in quite a while.  When
I did recently find myself in this similiar though not nearly so aggressive
situation, my first reaction was to fall into the drama and be effected by
the evil eye stares, etc.  After a couple of incidences, I realized that I
was falling for the trap of these kind of games and was no better myself in
doing so.  I was no longer an immature child and I wasn't about to start
acting like one.  The very next party that I saw this person at when I
happened to walk by them I treated them just like I would anyone else I
knew in the scene.  I smiled a big genuine smile, said hello, and gave them
a hug, made a little small talk and went on about my partying.  This
completely disfused the situation from that point forward.  We now are
completely amicable whenever we see each other and in time when all wounds
are completely healed and scars gone, we may be friends.  

The point is she wants to get a reaction out of you.  She was obviously
very hurt by this break up and at the very least it made her feel insecure
or like something was wrong with her.   By playing these kind of games she
can make herself feel better about the pain of the break up and feel more
secure about herself.  When you avoid her looks across the dancefloor,
leave the room when she comes in, don't say hello when she walks by, etc.,
you are feeding her right into her games.  These kind of reactions appear
to her like you are more insecure in yourself than she is and that she is
succeeding in hurting you like you did to her.  That is exactly what helps
her to feel better temporarily.  Eventually as the wounds naturally heal
and she moves on with her life (which through past experience I've seen
take as long as a year or two) this behavior by her would fade away.

The fast cure then is if you are not truly hurt by her and you are not
insecure about yourself than stop acting like it and fuelling her fire.  If
you see her givving you the evil eye across the dancefloor smile and wave. 
When you walk by her at a party say hello, you do know her, don't you? 
Don't you normally say hi to people you know as you walk by them?  Stop
treating her like your ex-girlfriend and start treating her the same as you
would any other friendly aquaintance.  Though I don't know you personally,
you seem like a nice, friendly, sensitive guy.  Get over your
uncertainties, Stop letting her get to you, Get on with your life, and
Treat her with the same genuine warmth you would offer any Joe Schmoe in
your life.  In addition to being able to be comfortable and relax at
parties, I think you will find that her wounds will heal much faster as
well.

Kill 'em with kindness 'cause it's hard to hate a warm,fuzzy teddy bear.

j.

JOHN CARMAN on TELEVISION -- `Teletubbies' Is Here -- Be Very Afraid 
     JOHN CARMAN
     Monday, April 6, 1998 
     1998 San Francisco Chronicle 

     URL: 
http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/1998/04/06/DD91651.DTL 

     Eh-oh! ``Teletubbies'' begins its assault on the plush-toy market 
today. The weekday kiddie show, imported
     from Britain, begins on PBS (9:30 a.m. on Channel 9), and Hasbro is 
ready. Soon the properly outfitted toddler
     will probably have bright-colored terry cloth pajamas and be within 
arm's reach of Teletubby replicas -- Tinky
     Winky, Laa-Laa, Dipsy and Po. 

     And a few nominal adults will probably be drooling and gurgling 
too. 

     It won't just be the plush toys. These Teletubbies are going to 
grind Barney the purple dinosaur into Barney bits.
     They're going to spawn Web sites bristling with Teletubby arcana. I 
wouldn't even rule out the prospect of
     religious cults. 

     Why do the Teletubbies have those blinking, unformed fetal faces? 
How about the little TV screens implanted in
     their bellies? What's the periscope-control mechanism in 
Teletubbyland? How about the mysterious pinwheel
     that radiates astral sparks -- or are they truly magic spores? I 
don't even want to think about the strange sun that
     shines over Teletubbyland. The sun encircles the face of a giggling 
baby. Bizarre things happen. The baby
     giggles. 

     In fact, I find ``Teletubbies'' downright frightening, for three 
reasons. 

     First, this is a TV show for 1-year-olds. It's a show for infants 
who will have no conscious memory of it. With
     its constant repetition, deliberate incoherence and bright visual 
style that evokes anyone's vaguest, earliest sense
     of springtime and Easter, ``Teletubbies'' presumably is exactly 
what infants want. If anyone understands the
     psychodynamics of infancy. 

     I don't care so much about all of that. What's scary to me is the 
fact that when the intended audience outgrows
     ``Teletubbies,'' it moves on up to ``Mister Rogers' Neighborhood.'' 
Now we actually have a preparatory TV
     show for Mr. Rogers. 

     Second, there are disturbing reports that when ``Teletubbies'' made 
its splash in England a year ago, certain
     noninfants there started combining the TV show with recreational 
drugs. 

     Think about that. I'm guessing that the only reason anyone would 
drop, say, acid tabs in the first place is to
     experience hallucinations that would look exactly like 
``Teletubbies.'' 

     The show is an immersion in thick green grass, buttery daisies, 
splotches of lavender, live bunnies strewn here
     and there on the landscape, and the four Teletubbies, whose 
movements and speech are devoid of rhyme and
     reason. 

     So why would anyone be dumb enough to do drugs and watch 
``Teletubbies''? It would be redundant. It
     reminds me of Bobcat Goldthwait's old line about Elvis Presley. He 
wondered why Elvis needed drugs when,
     with his money, he could hire midgets to perform hallucinations. 

     Third, ``Teletubbies'' is just plain creepy, and no less so for its 
surface gentleness. A colleague watched the
     review tape and had the sharpest observation yet about the show: 
``I find it strangely soothing,'' she said. With
     equal emphasis on both words. 

     I'll tell you something that happened on the tape. Po, the littlest 
Teletubby, comes across a flagpole sporting an
     aqua flag with an odd serpentine pattern on it. Po and Tinky Winky 
march up and down hills with this discovery,
     and between trees. Then they march it into the Teletubby hut, a 
cavelike dwelling that squats on the verdant
     Tubbyscape. 

     The flag is snapping above the hut, and all four Teletubbies are 
laughing and enjoying their good fortune, when
     the flag inexplicably vanishes. Zap, it's gone. Cut to the sun 
above, with its baby's face smiling slurpily. 

     Soon the narrator intones, ``The sun is setting in the sky, 
Teletubbies say goodbye.'' That's it; some giggling and
     commotion, and the show is over. 

     What happened to the flag, and what the hell was that all about? 
Just a little Teleglitch on the face of creation, or
     something meaningful? 

     Perhaps we are teaching 'em young. The great pinwheel spins, the 
sun laughs and poof, we're once again the
     victim of some incomprehensible cosmic joke. 

     1998 San Francisco Chronicle  Page E1

birthday, my 
> friends and I skipped school and spent the day in a park (in Boulder 
> CO).  All day.  Morn to dusk. Watched the clouds and listened to Led 
> Zeppelin for 9 hours.  'Somehow', I forgot to go to work that day
too. 
> Parents were worried.  I finally called, and Pop came to pick me up.
 I 
> opened the door of the Camry (which had no wheels-- rather, it was 
> levitating like Luke's landspeeder (?) vehicle in the first Star
Wars), 
> looked in, and saw that my dad was a Lizard.  His forked tongue kept 
> flicking out when he spoke.  I sat on the far edge of the seat as we

> >>From www.drudgereport.com
> >
> >INTENSE 'FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS' SCREENING HAD SOME IN
> >AUDIENCE LOOKING FOR EXIT
> >
> >UNIVERSAL sneaked its movie FEAR AND LOATHING IN LAS VEGAS Tuesday
> >night in North Hollywood. Being described as "one of the most bizarre
> >films ever made," the Terry Gilliam project based on a Hunter
Thompson
> >took them to hell and didn't let them come back during its 2 hour
> >screening.
> >
> >"I got sick afterwards," one attendee told the DRUDGE REPORT. "Like
> >they laced my popcorn with angel dust or something."
> >
> >Thompson's 1971 fuss-novel hits the screen after literally 25 years
in
> >development and 17 different scripts. Names like Nicholson, Scorsese,
> >John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd have been attached over the years. The
> >story follows the adventures of a ROLLING STONE magazine writer
> >[Johnny Depp] who is sent to Las Vegas to cover a Narcotics
> >Enforcement convention. Dark Comedy.
> >
> >No sex, very little violence, it was scenes of graphic drug-tripping
> >-- scenes that make the TRAINSPOTTING boys look like aspirin chewers
> >-- that shocked the crowd and had some looking for exit.
> >
> >One scene that goes down in a Casino has Depp hallucinating lizards.
> >
> >The 10 minute scene comes early in the film and sets tone. "He's in
> >this Casino and all of a sudden every one in it starts to turn into
> >creepy lizard-like creatures," describes a viewer. "Very
disturbing...
> >wacky."
> >
> >Depp smokes a cigarillo throughout the film making his continuous
drug
> >rants even more over the top, at times reducing him to nothing more
> >than a mumble. "Whenthegoinggetsweird, t h e weird turn pro," or
> >something like that. Depp acts out ether binges, coke tokes, LSD
> >attacks with surprising ease. Camera effects simulate the highs for
> >the viewer.
> >
> >One extended exchange between Depp and his attorney, who is tripping
> >out hard in a bathtub, was so intense and disturbing that several in
> >the screening audience walked out of the theater. [More than a dozen
> >found exit during the film, according to one estimate.]
> >
> >The drink and drug road trip of writer Depp and his attorney is set
> >for release in late May. Just how a new generation will relate to
> >Thompson's "Savage Journey to the Heart of the American Dream" is an
> >open question at UNIVERSAL. One executive hints that Depp's Hawaiian
> >shirt may become a fashion trend. The movie's soundtrack, said to
> >feature 70's lounge, may also start something.
> >

well me and phillip (the most kooliest guy) traveled out from sacramento to
san jose to go and check out the green gorilla louge. we meet up with my
girrrl lara and nico (hey baby you rock!) so we go to the g.g.l and it was
okay, iam not much into house music but it was kool. i meet guy and his friend
(hey were did you guys go?) they were kool kats. me and lara went on some
missions (lol) and then after the g.g.l eneded at 2 am we went on a mission to
find a hotel and get some sleep. hmmmmm like it took us forever to find a
hotel, but we finally managed and we all 4 fit into a queen size bed. that
morning we traveled to mickey d's for the sunday 39 cent cheese
burgers....mmmmmm they were good!
but all and all i had a good weekend. 
i got to see my girl lara (i love you woman)
phillip came and got me (thanks alot love....you are sweet)
i meet nico (hey superman...cute picture)
i meet megan (did you get some sleep?)
and i got out of the house!
thanks guys for a well need break for my ever so boring life.....it made this
monday a little more brighter and it made me relize just what wonderfull
friends i have!
love you guys!
amanda
p.s. hey i saw april too...cute new do girl!

Hello everyone.  I was making sure everyone knew about the new monday night weekly in downtown San Jose called TOP SHELF for the 21 and growing crowd. :) Each week there are three guest DJs including the resident M3. I've decided (uh oh a decision).. that it's time to collect some new RA
streaming
resources. Here's the ones I know about/visit most often. If people
could
stack this list with cool RA (real audio) or MPEG III (btw where do I
get an
mpegIII encoder: anyone got a decent one?) :

http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/ --> essential mix/ grooverider in the
listening room
(essential mix today is pretty good  like 25 minutes into the set)

http://www.hyperreal.org/music/DJsets/ --> good stuff here sometimes
(I've seen their list and have perused spots. Any gems people found?)

http://www.betalounge.com/archive/
(this is good)

http://www.netmix.com
(Did anyone listen to Laurent Garnier's set a couple months ago? phat)

So that's the mainstream sites I think. I know of a few personal
sites (i.e. catweasle's which I liked and somone from sacramento but
I forget the urls). I hope this list will grow huge. I spend a good deal
of
time online during the day. If you don't want to post send em to me
personally.
Thanks much...

hello michael,

hmmm... sounds like a messy situation, like most break ups are. i think
one of the hardest things to do when a relationship dissolves is to try
and see things thru the other persons perspective. whatever she is
feeling right now, hurt...stalked... sad... angry is real in her world
and it is the motivating force behing her actions. and likewise with you,
however you are feeling right now has motivated you to ask for advice
from your peers. 

there are several things you could do. but its important to look at what
outcome you want. do you want to be friends with her, acquaintances,
enemies, or indifferent ex lovers?

remember that there were things that attracted you two to "get to know
each other". and try to remember that however she is acting and reacting
right now is her mind and body's way of coping with her feelings. whether
or not it is healthy is something else. 

its the unfortunate thing about the human mind, or maybe society.
sometimes its so easy to remember who and how we've been wronged, but it
seems difficult to remember who and how we've been loved, helped, and
righted. and the really sucky thing is how difficult it is to rise above
the pain,rise above the people who have "wronged" us and deal with things
in a "mature" and healthy manner. and maybe even more difficult is to
reach out our hand and try to help them rise above the pain. but doing so
feels much better in the heart and soul. some say revenge is sweet, i say
its sour, bitter, rotten and ugly. 

karma, to me, is another way of viewing the golden rule "do unto others".
i have a qualm with viewing karma as "what comes around goes around".
it's to easy to use this saying as a justification for vindictive
behavior. karma is  how our actions spark other actions and reactions.
it's like a rock that you toss in a tranquil lake, the ripples reach
places of the lake which are hard to imagine. 

so, i dunno, these are some of my opinions gathered thru experience of
being on both sides of the wall. and in the end, whether you two decide
to continue the feud or heal severed ties, a good saying to remember is
"this, too, shall pass". i have met you at sanctuary and think you are a
really cool guy, so i hope things work out for you in a positive light.


-yasmin

p.s. a really good poem to read when you feel like people are being yucky
is maya angelous-"still i rise"

>I guess you can say that she's one of
>them sheep that feels wrong and bad if she does something that everybody
>else isn't doing.  She has no thoughts or her own and therefore shouldn't
>be worried about.

Hey, I think y'all are denigrating the sanctified hallows of sheephood
by saying that a person who acts despicably is a sheep. Sheep are
wonderful, friendly, inquisitive, intelligent, innocent, soft, and
cuddly! I've never met a sheep I didn't like. More people should be
sheep, cuz I've never met a bad sheep, but I've met many bad people.
Acting like the psychobitch described in this thread is very human --
but a good sheep will just say BAAAAAH to such behavior.

And contrary to popular belief, sheep *DO* have thoughts of their own,
but they're so cooperative and wonderful and kind to each other that
you monkeys think they're just running around in a mindless herd. This
is not so. They are infact part of  a greater sheep-mind that
harmonizes their lives from the great beyond, while allowing them to
express their individuality in such a way that doesn't cause conflict.
If only humans were so blessed, but alas, they're just a bunch of
not-so-evolved monkeys that think they're "all that" while still
running around slinging shit at each other.

So, if you want to transcend your meager human existances, please
repeat after me. BAAAAH. I am a sheep. BAAAAAH. 

Now there, Doesn't that feel better already?

Sincerely yours,
	Fluffy. (gosh, it's so hard to type when all you got is hooves!)
