wow, a lot of responses on this one.  i have a feeling this no tv
thing is gonna become something of an underground movement, one day
soon.  it's almost a subversive act - by not watching tv, you are
removing yourself from the reality plane of the VAST majority of the
american population.  even in the deviant subcultures i hang in, it
seems most people watch the tube.  to avoid it is to avoid the main
method of cultural indoctrination in this society.  what will we come
up with to replace it?

hmmm, i think i can use this angle to push my new religion.  soon as i
come up with one, that is...

-messiah wannabe

messiah wannabe wrote:

>  what will we come up with to replace it?

You're looking at it, bro.  The 'net is fast changing from a
means of light-speed communication and sharing of info and
ideas into a new breed of hucksterism and means of making
a buck.  Soon the net will be the focus of a severe backlash
like TV is just beginning to get now.  This may happen before
or after the whole thing goes down.  I give it two years.
You read it here first.

Ironically, I work for an internet company. . .

> come up with one, that is...

Can I set up your website . . ?

Steve.

messiah wannabe wrote:
> 
> wow, a lot of responses on this one.  i have a feeling this no tv
> thing is gonna become something of an underground movement, (snip)
 to avoid it is to avoid the main
> method of cultural indoctrination in this society.  what will we come
> up with to replace it?


We will replace it with the internet...same tube...different imput.
Tv could be a powerful tool to improve the world...if we 
got creative people to do the programming that was oriented
to something more helpful. maybe a messiah wannabe channel?

When i go to partys with real good visuals, i find these images
often open me up to some very inspirational, often spiritual
experiences. Of course the sight of mt shasts at sunrise
can do the same thing. The internet and computers
give individuals and artist the means to create these images
for the masses as well as giving the masses the choice as to
what they want to download into their synapses. It makes tv
interactive and gives the power and responsibility back to the people.

I went 5 years without tv..by choice and now watch it sporatically.
Those 5 years gave me a new perspective and now i watch
it with discretion and a perspective that allows me to
control my reaction as opposed to being a poor helpless
victim...i just dont buy this victim mentality.
I feel one needs to be aware of what is happening in the world
in order to improve it.

Like any other drug...you can use it or abuse it.
  

	><{{{">  <"}}}><

		foolish fish

Marc J wrote: 
>  i dont know anything
> about mic'ing a piano, but you could probably get cool sounds by just
> experimenting.  radio shack PZM mics sound miraculously good and theyre dirt
> cheap.  


Radio Shack PZM's are the best value for capturing sounds. Remember, they arent perfect 
for everything! But they are wonderful mic's. 

When micing a piano, Keep in mind the fat strings are the bass strings(yes, this is the 
origin of the term "Phat":)~) the thin strings are the 'highs'. One mic cant capture 
all the sounds that a piano puts out due to the distance between the fat strings and 
the thin strings. So begin your expirimenting with two mics spaced to best capture the 
full sound. The very best sound engineers debate over the placement of microphones, so 
this should tell you that everyone of the pro's has expirimented before deciding on his 
personal favorite placements. Expiriment. You can never know everything.

I posted something similar to this a couple of months
ago before my computer crashed and therefore was unable to follow 
up on it.
If anyone is interested in a new mailing list, mostly ravers
that want to discuss the spiritual and philosophical
aspects of raving and making the world a better place in general,
email me and i will send you a couple of web pages to check
out and get more info.

following is some of the suggested topics of the list.
The list is really taking off now and some really 
fascinating and inspirational people are participating.

	><{{{">   <"}}}><

		foolish fish

 

* Transformational powers of sound and dance
 * Community dance, music, celebration, and ritual as a viable and
   necessary form of community-building, love-generating,
   spirituality, and personal and planetary healing
 * Vibrational healing
 * Global networking of like-minded groups and individuals
 * Positive use of technology
 * Consciousness
 * Trance states, ecstatic trance-dancing, and other
   altered/enhanced states of awareness
 * Psychoacoustics
 * The free flow of light/information and creativity
 * Spirituality
 * Meditation / Energy Work
 * "Vibe" / Bioelectricity
 * Multidimensionality
 * Combined consciousness / group meditation / focused intent
 * Esoteric knowledge
 * Personal power and awareness
 * Actively co-creating a positive future
 * Deepening our connections to Earth
 * Deepening our connections beyond Earth

In Celebration of Good Friday.... Feel Good Friday will have .....
Free Candy
Free Water
Free Parking
Free Karma
Free Tapes
Free Flyers
Free Full Moon After Party
Free After Full Moon After Party
and even optional Free Admission

So here's the deal.....

    In the Spirit of Keepin' it Simple, and Keepin' it Real...  The Dj's
for the evening will be:     Kevin Kind,  Ghost,   Jazz-E,   Sahid from
Germany, Special Surprise Guest Dj Jesse 'Bad Boy' Martinez and MC Ray
Vonie.    Lighting and Visuals by I-Candy, and Sound by Xtreme Audio.
As well as Tons of extra stuff, banners, PLURple lighting, Outdoor chill
area, and separate kick back area....  and probably more surprise stuff.

    Feel Good Friday will begin at 9pm in San Francisco at the Landmark
RaveAtime Hall (aka Maritime Hall) in South of Market District at the
Corner of 1st and Harrison Streets.    Right across the street form the
Bank of America Clock.   And 1/2 block away from the Sound Factory.
All ages, sexes, and species are welcome.  For more detailed directions
from wherever you are coming from ... please consult a map.

    Feel good friday will continue, Weather Permitting, with a Free Full
Moon After Party in San Francisco with our friends from the SF House
Collective.   The Dj's will be :   Carlos, George, Melanie, and Jason +
other Guests.    The location for this will be given inside the party at
around 2 am, after the Full Moon is all set up.   This will go as late
as possible.

    But the fun doesn't end here... Because on Saturday, our friends
from House Blends will be continuing the festivities with an all day
event in San Francisco from Noon till 9pm   with DJ's:  Bloom, Tune,
Abdul, and Mes.   Info on this will also be give at the party.

    So it sounds like a lot of fun....  and here is even more good
news.....

The General Admission is only $10 WITH a Canned Food Donation to project
Open Hand.

For those of you that have Supported and Believed in FGE enough in the
past to purchase tickets in advance, Your Pre-Sale ticket stub from ANY
previous FGE party will get you in for only...... $5 with a canned food
donation.

And for those of you that really want a great deal....
If you buy a $20 Pre sale for 'Feel Good Forever' on May 23rd, you will
get in for FREE with a canned food donation.   And the first 100 people
will get a FREE 'Dreamers Paradise' Tape by DJ Sahid from Germany..
NOW That's A bargain and then some!!!!  :):):)

And the fun starts Friday at 9, so don't miss out, and get there early,
because there is a limited capacity.

Hope to see you all there.

Keep it real....   Vlad

---miss heart <sayzone@juno.com> wrote:
> 
> 3. who are some hip hop dj's with smokin skills from the east coast?

funkmaster flex from nyny is one, he does a hip hop radio show that's
pretty big in nyc, you can get tapes of his shows in underground rap
stores there.  a few years ago he put out a mix cd, which i bought. 
it's pretty cool, he cuts and scratches things up, and throws in
freestyle sessions from all the top rappers of the last few years. 
it's a pretty cool cd, the overall effect reminds me of rap shows you
hear on the east coast, with crazy mixin, people freestylin over live
beatloops, and the dj talkin the talk over the breaks...

he put out a second mix last year, but i didn't get it, so i don't
know if it's as good or not.

-messiah


ps. i keep askin people where i can go to hear some hip hop, but the
only place i've heard mentioned is deco.  oh yeah, and the elbo room. 
i know there's gotta be somewhere else.  has anyone out there been to
a kmel party?  kinda curious what that would be like...

Hi all,, 

I'm going to need help doing some promotional work over the next
while, and I need an 
intern.  It will be approximately 4 hours per week, usually on Monday
afternoons.  It 
will be mostly sending out promotional tapes of me and other Aware
Environments 
associates.  I am preferrably looking for someone who is more a dj or
promoter, this 
would be most beneficial for that type of person.  You must be able to
make it to the 
Berkeley area on Monday afternoons.  This is not a paid internship,
however, I do have 
decks at my office so I'm sure if you bring your records it won't be a
problem to hang 
out and spin here and there. 

Interested parties should email me.  This will be fairly long-term,
and the volume will be 
increasing after the first of the year.

interest.

here is a sample of what someone wrote today
on the list i have been telling you about. This
list is pretty interesting if you like this type of discussion.

	><{{{">   <"}}}><

		foolish fish

------------------------------------

That's what you call "liquid dancing"?  I do something like that quite a
bit.  As the dance deepens in trance, beams, waves, or balls of light
and energy often show up.  These energies can also take the form of
geometric shapes and patterns; the simpler ones are of spirals and
triangles.

At times we dance as separate beings.  Other times we become one and are
dancing through my body.  Two of the more complex shape patterns that
visit resemble a lotus blossom with a long root and streaming fount of
light, and the other is a multi-armed hydra like being shooting strands
of energy out from the arms in a web.  (And no, i am not doing
psychedelics during this, although i do imbibe a sacred toke or 2.)
When either are dancing me, my feet tend to be rooted to the earth.

I experience these energies as having not so much personalities, but
most definately sentience and purpose. I'm aware a communication usually
takes place during a visit.  After awhile i may step out of the dance
for a few minutes to capture the essence by drawing an image, or
speaking a few words into a tape recorder. Actually, a good portion of
Circle of Shaman was penned primarily through this type of trance dance
experience.

It also has the effect, as you mentioned Troy, of raising kundalini
energy, but this isn't limited to happening only with liquid
dancing.  Has anyone ever had what feels like an energetic orgasm during
dance?  (gee, i feel a blush comin on.  you don't even know me and here
i am getting so personal.  giggle.  oh well.)  Anyway, yes, i do feel
kundalini energy getting stimulated as well.  It varies in intensity
from xperience to xperience.

jed, regarding your concern about western culture not valuing dance and
other similar creative expression as healing or spiritual modalities - i
couldn't agree with you more.  Western religion has systematically
severed the the body from the head and called it and anything to do with
the sensual world sinful...the root of all desire that must be quelled
through transcendance.  The church fathers struck the part where Jesus
taught forms of sacred circle dancing which integrated breath, movement,
and chant as ways to, not just pray, but commune with God.  I'm
recalling that phrase in the Gospel of Thomas attributed to Jesus:  "To
the universe belongs the dancer.  S/he who does not dance does not know
what happens."  (Another translation is "does not know his
immortality.")  How interesting.  Does not know what happens.  There's
stories and info in dem rhythms!

HOW TO KILL THE TELEVISION MONSTER WITHOUT UNPLUGGING IT

1. turn off the sound on your TV

2. turn on two different stereo systems--one with your choice of wordless
music, the other with either AM radio or some spoken word stuff.

3. sit back and enjoy!  or take control by changing channels as the music
changes!

my personal favorite: late nite news with firesign theatre and aphex twin.
boy, there are some odd current events out there.

on a somewhat related note--imagine if the audio from boys' toy commercials
and girls' toy commercials were switched.

"I don't need
 A TV screen
 I just plug the aerial
 Into my skin
 And let the signals
 Run through my brain
 TV O.D.
 TV O.D."

Well, I must say that this was a very nice thing for my ears.  The sound
to it had was very acid and very smooth.  The mixing is very clean and
almost unnoticable.  I have to give phat props to him for just putting a
nice set together.  It even had my head bobbing while driving in the car
to the store.  Good job man. 

However, besides the overall beauty of the tape.  There was one
incredibly attrocious act committed that will be hard for me to forgive. 
So at the end of the first side, the tape just ended in the middle of the
song.  O.k., that kinda sucks but it usually isn't a big deal in my
reality.  However, the reason why I must bitch and moan is because it was
cut off by one of my all time favorite techno remixes in existence.  It
cut off right towards the beginning of the song Toxygene by the Orb. 
This remix is the "Kris Needs Up For a Fortnight Mix".  How could someone
have the gall to cut that one off at the end of a tape.  Hmmmmm, oh well.
 It was a good mixtape overall and I would recommend it to others to
purchase it for some good tunes to dance to.

Good Job C@

Bye all.

Drekster.

unknown.

Trip out! My friends and I used to do this back in middle school when I was a 
little skater. We would put on some cheese soap opera and mute it, and then
blare some hardcore ala Minor Threat, the Decendents, MDC, etc. There would be 
these occasional moments of briliance where the actors and actresses were 
synched up with the music and appeared to be singing along to 'John Wayne was a 
nazi', 'I'm not a loser' or other similar love songs. 

Back in the day,

Marie wrote:

>  I am new to raving, I thought I'd seek advice from you more experienced
> people. what aspects of raving do you think should be defined or presented?
> For example, I'm considering sections like massive vs. underground, candy
> raver/ candied up, music (to include DJs, trainwrecking, types of music, etc.),
> fashion, drugs..... suggestions?

    All that stuff is fine and dandy, but make sure you include the meaningful
aspects of raving.  Such as community, spirituality, individual expressionism,
diversified acceptance, and all the fundamental basics of what raving is all
about, not just the stuff at the parties.   But counterculture aspect of it's
origins, Its intrinsic valeu, and it's important place on our society, as well
it's contributions toward our cultural development and utopian dreams.

Keep it real...   Vlad

when i was 14 me and pj were in a band together with chuck (who went
on to drum for a band called superchunk) and steve (who went on to be
schitzophrenic).  we were the band with no name.  anyway my parents
had this OLD old vcr with this wierd button that said "audio dub" on
it.  if you pressed it while you were watching something, it would
record the sound from whatever channel was piping through it over the
original soundtrack of the tape.  or if you plugged in a microphone,
whatever the mike picked up.

we would stay up all night, recording random snippets of late-night tv
into bizzare cut and paste pastiches.  then, we'd rewind the tape, and
record strange industrial soundscapes over them, using guitars,
walkie-talkies, phazed spoken word rants, fans with tinfoil,  electric
organs, xylophones, and whatever else was handy...

-messiah wannabe

Subject: CA mayors vs feds on pot (NRR)
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Fri, 10 Apr 1998 01:19:29 PDT
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

 From the 604 list and sent by;

>From: SteveJPaul <SteveJPaul@aol.com>
>Date: Thu, 9 Apr 1998 14:20:27 EDT

                                   

>Wednesday March 18 9:42 AM EST 
>
>Calif. Mayors Ask Clinton: Spare Marijuana Clubs
>
>By Andrew Quinn 
>
>SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - A group of California mayors asked President
>Clinton Wednesday to block a federal suit against the state's marijuana
>clubs, sharply
>escalating the political and legal battle over medical marijuana use. 
>
>"At stake is the well-being of 11,000 California residents," the mayors
>of San Francisco, Oakland, Santa Cruz and West Hollywood said in 
letters
>to Clinton. They
>also asked him to suspend enforcement of federal drug laws that
>interfere with the clubs' daily operations. 
>
>"If the centers are shut down, many of these individuals will be
>compelled to search back alleys and street corners for their medicine,"
>the mayors wrote. "This will not
>only endanger their lives, but place an unnecessary burden on our local
>police departments." 
>
>The mayors' plea comes ahead of a March 24 hearing in San Francisco on 
a
>Justice Department bid to shut down six California marijuana
>distribution clubs on the
>grounds they violate federal drug laws. 
>
>The suit, one of two filed in federal courts in San Francisco and San
>Jose, marks a major legal skirmish over California's Proposition 215,
>the state law voters
>approved in 1996 which legalized marijuana use for people suffering 
from
>AIDS, cancer and other serious ailments. 
>
>California politicians are squaring off over the clubs, which have been
>the major source of marijuana for people who say it helps relieve a
>variety of symptoms ranging
>from pain and nausea to "nerves". 
>
>California's Attorney General Dan Lungren has personally vowed to see
>the clubs shut down, while local leaders such as San Francisco Mayor
>Willie Brown and city
>District Attorney Terence (eds: one "r" is correct) Hallinan have
>promised to keep them open. 
>
>Lungren's legal efforts were boosted last month when the state supreme
>court sided with a lower court ruling which said the clubs were illegal
>because they were not
>"primary care givers" for the patients they supply -- which is a
>condition set by the California measure. 
>
>Although the supreme court ruling set the legal groundwork for closure
>of the clubs, most are still operating and their leaders say they can
>fight the semantics in court. 
>
>Medical marijuana advocates are casting the battle as an issue of
>states' rights versus the federal government, saying federal officials
>should not be allowed to
>override a compassionate law approved by popular vote in California. 
>
>Federal officials say, however, they are not targeting "medical use" of
>marijuana -- simply the persistent violation of federal laws making it
>illegal to cultivate, possess
>or distribute the drug. 
>
>The mayors' letter urged Clinton to side with the clubs and said the
>federal government should allow local authorities to "formalize
>dispensary systems that live up to
>the spirit of the law, and most importantly, make marijuana available,
>safe and accessible to suffering patients." 
>
>They promised to abide by federal law, but asked for time to develop
>"airtight" regulation and supervision of the dispensaries. 
>
>"We ask that the federal government respect local government's
>experience and expertise in potentially developing legal 
community-based
>solutions that benefit the
>public health of our residents," the mayors wrote. 
>
>San Francisco's Hallinan Monday indicated he was willing to defend the
>city's right to set its own policies. 
>
>In court papers, Hallinan said that if the current distribution system
>were disrupted by federal interference, San Francisco may ask its 
police
>to step in "to distribute
>marijuana to seriously ill people." 
>
>^REUTERS@
>

that aired on Feb. 20, 1998 on videotape?

able to get an official copy from abcnews if it is possible.

Sorry if I'm gushing but I just got home from interviewing
dmarie, susan, and emily (sorry if I got those names wrong!)
from eklectic and they are great people.  Intelligent,
well-spoken, and friendly.  just fabulous.  I highly 
recommend that everyone check out their weekly if they
haven't already because great vibes + great people + great
music = a great time!  

It's people like these 3 women who help contribute to the scene.
and all of you, too, of course!

But anyhow, I'm just happy and I hope I do justice to the people
I interview and the parties I film cause my camerawork is a little
crappy. sigh.

much love
& besitos!
marie

At 08:53 AM 4/8/98 PDT, Nathan B wrote:
>I wonder what kind of 
>churn or turnover the list has.  Stats, Brian?  

Looks like in the month of March, there were 166 subscribes and 184
unsubscribes.  There apparently were a few people who appeared to subscribe
then resubscribe often, for some reason.  But most of those are unique; I
have no idea how many subscribed and then unsubscribed within the month of
March.  I'd say there's a fair bit of turnover there, when the total list
size is only 430.

As a point of interest, sfraves-calendar had 67 subscribes and 60
unsubscribes, and the total list size is 1237.

	Brian

Friday and Saturday are both big, with parties spread throughout Northern
Cali on Friday (SF, Sacramento, Modesto, Berkeley), and then the
Gathering on Saturday should be a good old-school party, the 
Reinforced Tour brings some jungle legends to the city, Frequency-8
continues its dedication to Trance, and finally, a real afterhours
party, Love Bizarre starting at 3:30am.  Then on Sunday, Stompy brings
it all back into the house.  I think I'm also going to try to make it
to Eklectic to start off the weekend...

           http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi

                                 Info Lines
                                      
     * Be-At Info Line - 415-626-4087. Usually has 5-10 listings, updated
       daily.
     * the Buzz-line, a global party network - 650.569.3300
     * Clubline - 415.979.8686
     * Frequency 8 Trance/Techno infoline - 415.541.5019
     * The Groove Line - 415.331.1500 ext.4788
     * Mixology-Music (north bay) - 707.526.1230
     * Housewares Rave Line - 415.281.0125
     _________________________________________________________________
   
                             Radio/TV/Net Shows
                                      
     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)
     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night midnight-1am - "Shortwave" - Electronic music in all
       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Monday night 9:30pm-midnight - "The Autobahn" w/dj Sutekh. Man and
       machine made music. KALX 90.7 (Berkeley)
     * Tuesday night 11:30pm-1:30am - "Conscious Groove" -
       ambientdowntempojunglehousetrancedrumnbasstriphop spun by weekly
       guest DJs. Hosted by Stephanie aka Miss fat slice. Free Radio
       Berkeley 104.1 (Berkeley)
       [4.7.98 - Tha Roman Show]
     * Wednesday night 9pm-11pm - free form music mix. KPFA 94.1
       (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning - "the tube" hosted by miss laura
       aka lola. an electronic excursion into ambient soundscapes,
       ethereal trance, and washes of other whimsical muzik. KAZU 90.3
       (Monterey Bay Community Radio)
     * Thursday morning 5am-7am - A postmodern Garrison Keillor on crack,
       DJ Boomerang Fidget spins hilarious tales of backwoods meth labs,
       urban decay and redneck ravers; all with a social conscience.
       Also, ambient & techno. Free Radio Berkeley 104.1 (Berkeley)
     * Thursday morning 10am-2pm - "The Further Adventures of Aardvark" -
       trip-hop to experimental to ambient to gabba etc, etc. KSJS 90.5
       (San Jose).
     * Thursday 7pm-11pm - The Beta Lounge - Live on the net - electronic
       music and culture, worldwide. http://www.betalounge.com/
     * Thursday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. The
       best in beats to satiate your inner child. Electronic dance,
       noise, spoken word, world music and more. Also available in
       RealAudio. KZSU 90.1 (Stanford)
     * Friday 10am-3pm - weekly DJ netcasts. x-radio.
     * Friday 3pm-6pm - free form music mix. KUSF 90.3 (SF) (also
       available on Realaudio
     * Friday 9:30am-noon - Snappy the Aligator plays deep groove music
       that dips into cool electronic sounds, classic soul, reggae &
       more. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on KUSF
       90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Jungle, Detroit, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, and
       noise KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - "Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs from
       SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night 11pm - Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. flux@flux.net
     * (every other) Saturday night 10p-12:30a - "1984" w/DJ Richtoffen.
       House, Trance and German rave. 90.1 (Chico)
     * Saturday night - "amp" 1am. MTV.
     * Saturday night - "Subsonic". 1am-6am, KITS 105.3 SF.
     * Saturday night - "House Nation" w/"Anthems Mix", Top 10s from
       guest DJs and "London Connection w/DJ Doubt". 2am-4am, WILD 94.9
       SF.
     * Ambiance Magazine - 9:30p weds-sun PNC Cable 2 (Modesto &
       Oakdale), 9p fri & sat, marcus cable ch 9 (ceres & turlock).

   For a search interface to the calendar, see the Late Train club

                            Administrative Notes
                                      
   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
    Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.org

From: Dina Alemagna <dmarie@gvo.com>
Subject: JUNGLE:  Eklektic:  Ground Score says...
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

...here's a little story I'd like to tell about three yin sisters you know
so well, it started way back in history with Miss E and Q and dmarie.  No ~
we had no little horsie named Paul Revere but....this is what we do have.

Eklektic

We would like to invite all y'all to the bumpin' upstairs jungle adventure
otherwise known as EKLEKTIC in SF. 

DJ Dara (NYC) alongside SF locals B (with a female MC) and Mateo of Control
Dek, will be filling your dance card, making your ass move and giving you
plenty to sweat to.

I know...I know, what about our residents Sage and Stareyes?  

Well,  Sage graciously gave up her set for fellow out of town junglist Dara.
Dara had grooved and dug our vibe back when Dieselboy was in town, but Dara
had not yet played Eklektic.  Since he's rollin through town, he asked to
gig.  Sage was down and why not, she still get's paid!  (=

So remaining true to our name Eklektic, so is our line-up.  DARA ~ B ~ Mateo
- tomorrow - thursday

A video on raving and will be shot by a college student working on her
thesis.  Metropolitan magazine star reporter Michelle Goldberg will be in
the house doing a review and write up, a Vancouver promoter will be chillin'
to check the SF scene, articles on flier art will be written and many
girlies swooning over Dara will be present.  

reminder:
Eklektic
579 Howard Street
SF, CA   415.332.5800 X24-7
21+  5 bones  10-2
eklektic@hotmail.com
bookings:  Ground Score
647 Cole Street
SF, CA 94117
attn: dmarie

So what do I say...Ground Score 411:

*       Home Invasion, yes, Home Invasion is comming to SF.  May 7th, N20
productions/ Home Invasion will take over the city.  In-stores, the basement
at Nikita, Future Breaks radio show (futurebreaks@hotmail.com), and of
course Eklektic.  Representing for Home Invasion will be R.A.W. and Oscar
da' Grouch.  If you have any interest in this tight team giggin or stoping
by your shop, dropping records, whatever, give dmarie a call at the contact
information above.  More info on this tour soon.  Locals;  Keep your eye out
~~ this shit's tough.       *

SPECIAL UP COMMING EVENT:

*       Saturday - April 11th, Buggin Out and the Terrorist Society, XLR8R
and Magic
Circle bring you:  ENFORCE with 4Hero, Stretch, DJ Rebel and MC M.A.D.

History Lesson:  Dego is one of the founding members of Reinforced (circa
1989) delving into d n' b with partner Mark as 4 Hero.  He has established
himself in the downtempo world as Tek-9, and runs UK techno label
Reflective.  DJ Rebel, a co-owner of Reinforced, he has deemed himself in
the world of d n' b as a definitive DJ and representative of one of the
finest labels.  Stretch, The DJ mastermind behind the most recent Enforcers
mixed CD, Stretch also runs techstep label A-KO., and MC M.A.D.

BONUS:  6PM-9PM = happy hour with drink specials and tunes by local
favorites Sifu, Honey B and Push.  

this special event occurs at the Justice League.  Information:  Buggin Out
415.522.2343  Magic Circle 415.281.0772    

Yes, and I'll be there to capture in time and on film the hapnin's.  What's
new huh?

Oh there's so much more...lot's more...but not till next time.  The clock
strikes 5 and it's time to fly-

respect as always,
dmarie
Ground Score

	[Steven Allas]  I would be interested to know how many hours
everyone spends in front of their computer.  I know I rack up some
unruly hours on mine, both at work and at home.  Would the reasoning be
that at least on the computer you are thinking whether surfing sites or
chatting?  I can say honestly that I do plan my t.v. consumption around
sports, discovery channel specials, or a&e.  I don't watch the t.v. for
news much.  I build a base of contacts around the world and we
communicate through e-mail or talk on freetel.com.  I doubt the media
gives us the real news so I'd rather find it myself from private
citizens. 

	aloha,
	moki

> ----Original Message Follows----
> 
> no, i didn't make it to notv at 1015 this week, though i've been
> before, and liked it.  actually, i'm just talking about not having a
> tv.
> 
> i don't own one, and neither do my roomates.  it's a personal choice
> we've all made, and one that we're all pretty happy with.  when you
> lose that fuckin box sitting in the living room, all sorts of neat
> activities spring up to fill the gaps.  talking for instance.  sure,
> we all like chatting with friends, but when the tv is around, it's all
> to easy to turn it on, and turn your friends (and yourself) off.  lose
> the tv, and suddenly you're forced to entertain each other.  and
> believe me, my roomies are _definitely_ funnier than any tv program
> out there.  well, except maybe for mst3k...
> 
> we also play a lot of games: poker, backgammon, chess, scrabble,
> grass...  i never used to play most of those games, but i find i
> really enjoy them now.  they're like these little microcosms,
> miniature replicas of the game of life, or some facet of it.  i can
> feel my mind expanding, getting more limber, especially playing
> something challenging like chess.  learning little lessons that can be
> applied to the real world...
> 
> granted, there have been times i've come home from work and found
> myself too tired to do a damn thing, even talk.  but on those rare
> occasions, i simply allow myself to "turn off" on the couch, as if i
> had a television, and just veg.  sure, i probably look sorta funny,
> but that's just cause everyone associates that vegetative state with
> watching tv.  i find i enjoy it better without, i just sit back, maybe
> roll one, listen to some tunes, and let my thoughts wander.
> 
> tv is like this fucking drug, you turn it on and you just sit there,
> immobile, eyes glassy, staring at this one spot.  well, i've been in
> that state without the help of a television set, but the thing was, i
> was at least thinking my own thoughts.  if you're watching tv, you're
> silently absorbing all kinds of sick little messages:  i'm fat, i'm
> ugly, i need to diet, i need to eat some burgers, i need a new car,
> new clothes, i don't need it but it's on sale so i can save money by
> buying it...  it's not just the commercials, the commercials pay for
> every second of tv you see, and that's reflected in the programs,
> implicitly.  everybody lives in these dream apartments with furniture
> they couldn't afford if they really worked at a newspaper or whatever,
> and you just sit there and feel more and more inadequate, but
> subconsciously...
> 
> ok, maybe that sounds a little paranoid, and perhaps it is.  and there
> are plenty of other socializing mechanisms in this culture to make you
> a little consumerclone, and i'm still vulnerable to some of them.  but
> honestly, i think that's what tv's all about, selling shit, and i
> wouldn't put it past the networks to find a thousand little ways to
> implant suggestions in your brain, all of them centered around your
> buying the sponsor's product.  certainly they would if they could,
> don't you think?
> 
> anyway, i don't think i'm gonna go back to owning a tv anytime soon...
> 
> 
> -messiah
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

I believe this shows that he is really into his art.
That he is so intranced by the music he is spinning
he honestly doesn't recognize the tape is ending. I
consider this a good thing. 

I have been reading how folks are complaining about
one side of the tape ending in the middle of a song.
This shows improvisation at its best, the set isn't
all planned out he is playing what feels right. I
hate it when people plan out every mix it just
doesn't seem very much like true mixing. I will play
maybe one or two mixes that I know are going to rock
and feel the rest of the set. My props to C@ Weasel
for playing by what he feels!

Oh! Derek I know your just being facetious it was just
a good opportunity to make a point, lates.

LL

After a very enlightening meeting, and an incredible performance by
the "George Lucas Love Slave All-Stars", Joshie, Stevie and I fought
the evil forces of sleep and went out to Eklektic
to dance and dance and dance to some incredible music.


As soon as you started walking up the stairs, you could feel the heat
ooooozing out into the stairwell.  BOOOOOOM into the room as you pop
through the doorway, and such nice faces smile and boogy up to you. 
It was impossible to just stand around, some part of you had to move. 
The beat grabbed your body and made it groove all around.  The whole
room was just bumping up and down, together, so it
looked like one huge beast.  Every once in a while a hand would pop up
to give it up for the dj.  It was just real swell, you know?

And this little chicky smiled all the way home to Santa Cruz.


Tabitha

From: drekster@juno.com (Derek J Fieldsoe)

However, besides the overall beauty of the tape.  There was one
incredibly attrocious act committed that will be hard for me to forgive. 
So at the end of the first side, the tape just ended in the middle of the
song.  O.k., that kinda sucks but it usually isn't a big deal in my
reality.  However, the reason why I must bitch and moan is because it was
cut off by one of my all time favorite techno remixes in existence.  It
cut off right towards the beginning of the song Toxygene by the Orb. 
This remix is the "Kris Needs Up For a Fortnight Mix".  How could someone
have the gall to cut that one off at the end of a tape.  Hmmmmm, oh well.
 It was a good mixtape overall and I would recommend it to others to
purchase it for some good tunes to dance to.

From: tabitha hanrion <bewitched@rocketmail.com>
Subject: NRR:Friday Music...
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


I work in Monterey. Sure is a perdy place indeed.  I finally had to
turn my desk around so I didn't face the ocean. Too distracting.  I
got to the point where I thought the otters were mocking me.  But
occasionally I see the reflection of the ocean on my computer monitor
and I take a look.  Really beautiful all by itself.

But just a few minutes ago I popped in my King Britt presents Sylk 130
*When The Funk Hits the Fan* cd, and now it's just plain goofy.

The waves are wooshing in and out to the same time as the songs. 
People walking around almost look like they're dancing, or at least
have a bit of a groove in their step.  And this dog walked by and his
tail was wagging to the same beat as some of the vocals.

Normally Monterey has this cheesie quality to it, but now with King
Britt in the background, everyone doesn't seem as white bread.

For anyone who hasn't heard this CD, go get it.  Dig in the couch  for
spare change if you have too. It's not just a bunch of songs, it's
like a history lesson in funky music, using old styles and new styles.
 Ahhhh....


La Te Da. I need sleep.

Tabitha

not bombs party at Golden gate park and also info on a party at 17th

on the sixxth or something.

I haven't heard the tape youre' refering to, but I did get the pleasure of
hearing C@tweasel spin at Velocity Quest and his set blew my mind. I am very
impressed by his music and his style. If his tape sounded anything like what
the set I heard him spin was then the tape is amazing. However I can also
understand Derek's point (duh I just posted about it a few days ago) about
getting into a track and have it cut out in the middle, and I realize
sometimes the tape isn't long enuf but maybe just fade out the track at the
end of the tape so as not to be as painful on the ears and the heart. I
really look forward to getting to hear this tape soon.

MooK<><
-----Original Message-----
From: Layne Loomis <lucke@rocketmail.com>

Date: Friday, April 10, 1998 7:37 AM
Subject: Re: Review of C@ Weasel's Tape. ; o )


>I believe this shows that he is really into his art.
>That he is so intranced by the music he is spinning
>he honestly doesn't recognize the tape is ending. I
>consider this a good thing.
>
>I have been reading how folks are complaining about
>one side of the tape ending in the middle of a song.
>This shows improvisation at its best, the set isn't
>all planned out he is playing what feels right. I
>hate it when people plan out every mix it just
>doesn't seem very much like true mixing. I will play
>maybe one or two mixes that I know are going to rock
>and feel the rest of the set. My props to C@ Weasel
>for playing by what he feels!
>
>Oh! Derek I know your just being facetious it was just
>a good opportunity to make a point, lates.
>
>LL

Is this the RA file that starts off, in a speak-n-spell sort of voice:
"The Future Sound of London, Live via I S D N"?

I've got a shitter of a proxy here at work, and can't get alot of RA files
that aren't made available via streaming HTTP, but I can get this one.
I've got a tape deck (shitty dumpster find, but it works), and I can
record this.

I've just started listening to it, and yeah, it rocks.  FSOL has undergone
a sort of change since I started listening to them back in the Amorphous
Androgenous/Papa New Guenia (?)  days...they were hella ambient back then,
now they're more like trip-hop almost.  It blew my mind when I heard the
"We Have Explosive" single...FSOL doing straight up big-beat, almost!

They rock...I'm definitely gonna bring a blankie tape in next week and
record this. 

Hey, how many, or any, sfravers also check out the IDM list?  lemme know!

-jimg

>"Mook" <mcarey@triad.com> said:
>> I thought "phat" came from when peeps would be smokin a phat bowl or other
>> related paraphanelia.
>
>i always figured that the word was in reference to one's pants. nobody told
>me this though, i guessed it for myself. i know, silly me...
>
>joe


This word was used in the black ghettos long before ravers used it.
the first time i ever hear the word was a black kid in Baltimore describing
a girl to me,
and I was like  "you think she's fat??  Geepers homey, are you nuts?!"

it was an acronym, he told me, for "Poossy, Hair, Arse, Tets", as in:  "she
has a nice body."

yes, i know, it's crewd & lude.  i read a hip/hop history book recently and
it gave the same definition.  Supposedly it originated in the late 60's or
early 70's.

November of 96 or not long after that (I remember this coz the first Audio
Impact was around then, and I got a free tape with Flux spinnin oldskool
beats and Jason Mouse on the other side)... Jason Mouse runs his own label
Emocean Records (or ran, I'm not sure), has produced a few of his own
tracks  and lives out here now, and
frequents for a bunch of krus' weeklies, but I'm not sure if he's a member
of Phunckateck or not.. I don't think he is.. dmarie, i bet you got the
411!! :)

Lara wrote:

<<Jason Mouse runs his own label Emocean Records (or ran, I'm not sure), has
produced a few of his own tracks  and lives out here now>>

In regards to Jason running Emocean, It was actually Steve Barons label(still
is...check the newest release with XLR8R's Andrew Smith(a.k.a RED ORC) and
himself / "FUNKED UP"). Jason was helping run it as well as being an artist
for the label. Jason no longer works with the label, but still continues to
produce.


<<I'm not sure if he's a member of Phunckateck or not.. I don't think he
is..>>

He is a member of PHUNCKATECK...and has been since he moved out here.


<<this brother is serious about his jungle, and it shows in his KICKIN SETS!>>

Jasons talents, both in production and DJing, are highly regarded by all of us
in the crew. I speak for everyone in PHUNCKATECK when I say that he is the
best DRUM & BASS producer in the U.S. We definetley give him room to swing his
axe, while we watch and learn. The reason we asked if he'd like to be a part
of PHUNCKATECK is because of his prominent love for what he does.....that is
something that we are about, and we hope that it comes thru everytime we play
or make tracks.
 
Respect,
Noel

t.v. is such escapism...people avoid all aspects of themselves to 
saturate themselves with t.v. : the Passive Medium. passive becuz you 
just sit there and take in take in take in! there is absolutely nothing 
interactive about it; too much breeds social stuntedness, i think. i 
don't watch it and haven't for a couple of years....well, with the 
exception of the occasional x-files, south park (ha! those little kids 
are twisted--get more from the inet than t.v. tho') and ....... ok, ok. 
jerry springer. and believe me, it isn't something I'm proud of. it just 
holds some kind of sick allure because it is so twisted!!! total 
hyperbole. it just seems sooo distorted and it makes me laugh! it's like 
gorging on mickie d's: you crave it, you eat it, it tastes good and you 
almost get high just knowing you've done something bad and there is this 
little thrill involved....yeah, jerry is my mcdonald's french fry. 
greasy, catch a taste of it, feel ill, turn off the toob for a few 
months. saturated.
p.s. definitely not down with kicking pregnant women.
CL

>On Wed, 8 Apr 1998 21:39:45 -0700 (PDT) messiah wannabe
><messiahw@yahoo.com> writes:
>>
>>
>>no, i didn't make it to notv at 1015 this week, though i've been
>>before, and liked it.  actually, i'm just talking about not having a 
>>tv.
>>
>>i don't own one, and neither do my roomates.  it's a personal choice
>>we've all made, and one that we're all pretty happy with.  when you
>>lose that fuckin box sitting in the living room, all sorts of neat
>>activities spring up to fill the gaps.  talking for instance.  sure,
>>we all like chatting with friends, but when the tv is around, it's all
>>to easy to turn it on, and turn your friends (and yourself) off.  lose
>>the tv, and suddenly you're forced to entertain each other.  and
>>believe me, my roomies are _definitely_ funnier than any tv program
>>out there.  well, except maybe for mst3k...
>>
>>we also play a lot of games: poker, backgammon, chess, scrabble,
>>grass...  i never used to play most of those games, but i find i
>>really enjoy them now.  they're like these little microcosms,
>>miniature replicas of the game of life, or some facet of it.  i can
>>feel my mind expanding, getting more limber, especially playing
>>something challenging like chess.  learning little lessons that can be
>>applied to the real world...
>>
>>granted, there have been times i've come home from work and found
>>myself too tired to do a damn thing, even talk.  but on those rare
>>occasions, i simply allow myself to "turn off" on the couch, as if i
>>had a television, and just veg.  sure, i probably look sorta funny,
>>but that's just cause everyone associates that vegetative state with
>>watching tv.  i find i enjoy it better without, i just sit back, maybe
>>roll one, listen to some tunes, and let my thoughts wander.
>>
>>tv is like this fucking drug, you turn it on and you just sit there,
>>immobile, eyes glassy, staring at this one spot.  well, i've been in
>>that state without the help of a television set, but the thing was, i
>>was at least thinking my own thoughts.  if you're watching tv, you're
>>silently absorbing all kinds of sick little messages:  i'm fat, i'm
>>ugly, i need to diet, i need to eat some burgers, i need a new car,
>>new clothes, i don't need it but it's on sale so i can save money by
>>buying it...  it's not just the commercials, the commercials pay for
>>every second of tv you see, and that's reflected in the programs,
>>implicitly.  everybody lives in these dream apartments with furniture
>>they couldn't afford if they really worked at a newspaper or whatever,
>>and you just sit there and feel more and more inadequate, but
>>subconsciously...
>>
>>ok, maybe that sounds a little paranoid, and perhaps it is.  and there
>>are plenty of other socializing mechanisms in this culture to make you
>>a little consumerclone, and i'm still vulnerable to some of them.  but
>>honestly, i think that's what tv's all about, selling shit, and i
>>wouldn't put it past the networks to find a thousand little ways to
>>implant suggestions in your brain, all of them centered around your
>>buying the sponsor's product.  certainly they would if they could,
>>don't you think?
>>
>>anyway, i don't think i'm gonna go back to owning a tv anytime soon...
>>
>>
>>-messiah
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>

Received: from [207.215.85.234] by send1b; Sun, 12 Apr 1998 10:17:12 PDT
Date: Sun, 12 Apr 1998 10:17:12 -0700 (PDT)
From: AlwayzSpun <sandman978@yahoo.com>
Subject: whatsgoingonhere?
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk





In the 20'z we had the Flapperz and Anti-Prohibition 
Gang warz...
In the 40'z, we had the Zoot Suiterz, and the Lindy Hopperz.
In the 60'z,Woodstock waz the most spectacular display
of human love and affection ever witnessed at one gathering
any where on the face of the planet. Oh yeah, the funky
concept of tie-dye waz invented at this point by the cool 
ass hippy'z.
In the 80'z, we were still reeling from the effects of the
disco dancin John Travolta and the one and only Soul Train.
This said era waz dominated by such comical characterz az
'Boy' George and Cindi Lauper. I don't know what to call
them, and let's not forget about Madonna'z rize to fame with
hits like Border line and Jimmy Jimmy. 
    Now entering the New Millenium, a new breed haz arizen.
Enter the Party Kidz. Underaged Adolescents staying
out way past every1'z curfew and cramming every conceivable
illicit substance down their throats and just trying to get
az fucked up az they can.
While we all have had our share of spending a whole night
drooling in the corner spun out of our mindz while attending
a phat party, most of us had the common sense to realize 
that this waz not acceptable behaviour to carry out on a 
weekly basis. But not the Rave Baby. Party Kidz are nothing
more than Rave Babiez who grew out of the habit of getting
az aced out of reality az they could only after they had 
hit rock bottom(getting strung out, lozing everything, and
only then realizing addiction to whatever poizon they had 
picked).
    Okay, so while some of us continued to get wasted, and 
otherz realized that wasted wazn't where it waz at, we still
have a new wave of party goerz entering the scene every month.
What impression are the newcomerz supposed to get about the
now clouded and confuzed scene?
Even in the magic mushroom dayz of the hippiez and the mystic
mescaline dayz of Heavy Metal viewerz, in the dayz before
LSD waz banned, people were not getting az fucked up az the 
Rave Babiez. Oddz are that any new gen-Xer entering the scene
now will partake of more controlled substancez within a 
month than the freelovin' swingin' sex-pressive hippiez of 
the 60'z did in 2 or more months. 
    However, with the help and aid of an experiened guide,
the guiding hand of an experienced party goer, new rave
babiez won't have to learn the true meaning of a rave the
hard way. I mean yeah sure,everyone wants to get a little
blasted and high az fuck, therez no problem with that. Ya
wanna hippy flip, cool... Candy flip, go right ahead, MX Missle,
Fire away, Coco puffs, I'm cuckoo, parachuting your thing,
feel free to do so.
What I'm saying iz that there iz no need to try out 4 
different drugz at the same sitting. And I feel that this 
point iz not made clear for most first time raverz, who get
the obvious yet wrong impression about the type of thing to
do at a good party by nitro sucking shroom swallowing smoked
out speed snorting e-kid laying in hiz own puddlez of urine 
and multicolored vomit... Get what I'm sayin?
    Misunderstand me not, I've been more than my fair share 
of high before, but I've never been incoherent and I've never
not known what I've just put in my body. I've also never put
hellacious amounts of entheogenz in my body.
I've heard of people taking 4-5 hits of E within the same 
2 hourz trying to 'Get Off' az best they can. Ten hits of
acid disappear down the same manz throat. Half an ounce of 
shroomz 'tween teo people... Or how bout the first timer
with their paycheck in their pocket on Friday night answering
to every call of 'X' and 'Fry', az well az getting taken by
the venderz and people selling other shit. Why not make
it clear from the beginning of the party that you're not
suppozed to get all fucked up beyond belief. I've recently
seen a flier that stated right on the front that G would not
be tolerated within its doorz. Its not much by itself, but,
its a great start for what it's worth. There iz nothing 
wrong with getting your high on, but be selective when
wasting the limited grey matter. You only have so much of 
it and you can only get so high at one time... No matter
how much pot you smoke, you'll only get so stoned. No matter
how many hits of E you take, you're gonna get spun. There iz
no need to take more than two hits of acid, you're gonna fry.
You don't need to eat more than two eigths of shroomz cuz 
you're still gonna get off. This iz the Point that so many
have difficulty understanding, sillly az that might be. I 
guess some assume that 20 hits of Fry will make you see more
than 2-3 hits will. Might be true, but you'll be just az 
fuckin incapacitated so what doez it really matter? Sure 
you will relive the sinking of the Titanic after 1/2 oz. of
shroomz, but you'll be so fuckin shroomed out that you won't remember
shit about sinling anyway. So maybe it will feel
8 timez az good to drop 4 hits of X instead of 1 or 1-1/2.
Who carez if you're E'n so hard that your teeth grind and 
no one can understand a fuckin word your sayin... 
     I guess this iz nothing more than a warning early 
Easter 98 mornin for the purpose of lettin y'all know some
one iz concerned with the posterity of the scene, and I do wish
to keep all my party peops alive until we're old and decrepit
haz been fart knockerz doin dancez in front of our kidz
like our parents do in front of us... But if we keep destroyin
ourselvez, by not watching out for each other, where will
we be in the near future. What will we have in the near future.
Sure I can down 40 geltabz and not sweat it, but can I 
eazily and clearly what I waz doin exactly what I waz doin
1 year ago? 
    If reading this made you scratch your head or set off
a warning light somewhere in the back of that partied out
teenage brain of yourz, Take a sec to look at your involvement
in the scene... How involved are you really? How much are 
you doing really? What do you spend on drugz really? How many
different 1'z are you on at your partiez? 
I'm exhausted and can no longer continue, so pleaze feel 
free to get back to me any time you pleaze...    
    Only cuz I care...
-AlwayzSpun-
 
"The most violent element in Society iz Ignorance"

-source unknown-









==
The Cali 1 who'z AlwayzSpun,
livin life and havin fun...
Gettin high late at night,
Alwayz rollin through hiz life
Not knowin what to do or where to go
Eatin shroomz and snortin blow...
That nigga

To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Sun, 12 Apr 1998 12:58:08 -0700
Subject: Spring break reviews (dayz 4,5,6,7 of 10)
Message-ID: <19980412.130513.6062.3.mook007@juno.com>
X-Mailer: Juno 1.49
X-Juno-Line-Breaks: 0-2,11-13,21-23,30-32,39-40,42
From: mook007@juno.com (I MooK I)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Although very belated, here is the continuing MooK saga of spring break.

Day 4: 
Checked out the second week of Afterglo at the Cactus club in SJ. Met a
lot of SFRavers danced my patutes off and had a blast. The music was
outstanding, but there was no jungle that night =(. Got to hear Monty
spin and I just fell in love with the one track by Melloween called the
King that he spun. WoW!! (For those that don't know it- its a house track
that has MLK's Let Freedom Ring speech mixed over a nice beat) AndyW
rocked the house early and Li closed up with a sweet set. However I think
is the night I started to come down with the cold that cut the dance
marathon short later in the week.

Day 5:
I am really ragged at this point. I take some of my non raver frenz to
Static and they were very freaked out ;) They were definately not
expecting that kind of crowd or muzak. I danced real hard to some really
tight jungle. I met up with Lauren G (Hi there!) and apparently there
were more SFR's that showed up but my frenz eventually wanted to go to a
bar that they were more comfortable at so we went bar hopping and ended
up playing pool in this empty Irish bar somewhere in the city. Aches and
sneezing had really set in by the end of the night.

Day 6:
I wanted to go danceing but there was no way my body would let me. I
posted this to the list and to my delight I got a lot of get well soon
emails =D Basically I went over to a frenz house and we watched South
Park  expecting to see who the fat kidz dad was but it was April Fool's
so they didn't show the episode (I don't really watch the show so I
wasn't too bothered but my frend was pissed) Didn't get much sleep but
whatever it was spring break.

Day 7:
I decided to save my energy for the weekend so went to see the Wedding
Singer (Hysterical fits of laughter caused by this movie) and again ended
up getting home VERY late that night. Since I worked a 40 week on Spring
Break I was going into work very haggard lookin in the mornings and it
was taking several injections of Caffeine to get me going (I was doing
Double tea bags per cup as tea has a higher concentration of caffeine
than coffee)

Stay tuned for the exciting conclusion that blew my mind and ended my
spring break like nothing else  ever could

Content-ID: <0_892412168@inet_out.mail.aol.com.1>

  I may as well take the time to respond to this.

    Drugs are an integral part of the rave scene.  Whether we like to admit it
or not..  the scene would not exist without drugs.  They are there... they
exist.  I took this post as an insult.  I was not "guided" into the rave scene
and taught the "proper way" to view it all.  I came with my own preconceived
notions and my own experiences and I made what I could of it.

   Raving is not a huge movement to conform the masses.  We make it so
beautiful because of our differences.  and if that means being a sober raver,
or getting fucked up every weekend, it doesn't matter.  You can't tell someone
what to do.  You can only help them out and stand by them.  

Not every raver becomes an addict.  I don't deny that drug use is a big
problem in our scene.  But it is also an advantage.  It is part of the journey
you take when you go to a party.  To transform your entire way of viewing the
world and taking it away from the party with you.  

   Now I have to take time out to say this is not a flame.  I do agree with
AlwayzSpun (was that meant as a twist of irony? =)  We DO NEED MODERATION!! It
is a MUST.  You can take your CandE and your Psychedelics and other things,
but know that THey ARE harming you, and that if you do too much you are doing
damage to your body/mind.  I know there are those people out there who are
getting mad at me and saying "NO!! Drugs are a learning tool and they are
wonderful!!!"  Well, yes, they are. 
But they are also DRUGS.  And you have to be realistic and take responsibility
for the fact that you are altering your body, no matter how fun and good it
feels.  

(GRR can you all tell I'm practicing to grow up and be the Next Leslie??)  I
do drugs.  I'm not ashamed of it.  But you have to be smart about it and not
get too fucked up all of the time.  

There will always be new teenyboppers coming into the scene and getting
involved with the drugs.. because the drugs are there, and they are available.
And where else can you really get away with it so openly??  The question is
How can we stop it?? is there really a way to get to every new person that
enters the scene and open their eyes to sober raving?? And do we really want
to do this??  I think we should let everyone choose their own path and have
their own experiences.  THe most we can do is set an example.  Heheh... so
who's ready to hand over their drugz???

My Two Cadbury creme eggs.....


     hugs n'stuff
    trice the tekno diva

 "What's so amazing that keeps us stargazing.. and what do we think we might
see? Someday we'll find the rainbow connection- the lovers, the dreamers, and
me."
                                                                    --Kermit
THe Frog

=================
Raving is my religion.
The DJ is my shaman.
Dancing is my prayer.

--part0_892412168_boundary

Date: Sun, 12 Apr 1998 10:17:12 -0700 (PDT)
From: AlwayzSpun <sandman978@yahoo.com>
Subject: whatsgoingonhere?
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit





In the 20'z we had the Flapperz and Anti-Prohibition 
Gang warz...
In the 40'z, we had the Zoot Suiterz, and the Lindy Hopperz.
In the 60'z,Woodstock waz the most spectacular display
of human love and affection ever witnessed at one gathering
any where on the face of the planet. Oh yeah, the funky
concept of tie-dye waz invented at this point by the cool 
ass hippy'z.
In the 80'z, we were still reeling from the effects of the
disco dancin John Travolta and the one and only Soul Train.
This said era waz dominated by such comical characterz az
'Boy' George and Cindi Lauper. I don't know what to call
them, and let's not forget about Madonna'z rize to fame with
hits like Border line and Jimmy Jimmy. 
    Now entering the New Millenium, a new breed haz arizen.
Enter the Party Kidz. Underaged Adolescents staying
out way past every1'z curfew and cramming every conceivable
illicit substance down their throats and just trying to get
az fucked up az they can.
While we all have had our share of spending a whole night
drooling in the corner spun out of our mindz while attending
a phat party, most of us had the common sense to realize 
that this waz not acceptable behaviour to carry out on a 
weekly basis. But not the Rave Baby. Party Kidz are nothing
more than Rave Babiez who grew out of the habit of getting
az aced out of reality az they could only after they had 
hit rock bottom(getting strung out, lozing everything, and
only then realizing addiction to whatever poizon they had 
picked).
    Okay, so while some of us continued to get wasted, and 
otherz realized that wasted wazn't where it waz at, we still
have a new wave of party goerz entering the scene every month.
What impression are the newcomerz supposed to get about the
now clouded and confuzed scene?
Even in the magic mushroom dayz of the hippiez and the mystic
mescaline dayz of Heavy Metal viewerz, in the dayz before
LSD waz banned, people were not getting az fucked up az the 
Rave Babiez. Oddz are that any new gen-Xer entering the scene
now will partake of more controlled substancez within a 
month than the freelovin' swingin' sex-pressive hippiez of 
the 60'z did in 2 or more months. 
    However, with the help and aid of an experiened guide,
the guiding hand of an experienced party goer, new rave
babiez won't have to learn the true meaning of a rave the
hard way. I mean yeah sure,everyone wants to get a little
blasted and high az fuck, therez no problem with that. Ya
wanna hippy flip, cool... Candy flip, go right ahead, MX Missle,
Fire away, Coco puffs, I'm cuckoo, parachuting your thing,
feel free to do so.
What I'm saying iz that there iz no need to try out 4 
different drugz at the same sitting. And I feel that this 
point iz not made clear for most first time raverz, who get
the obvious yet wrong impression about the type of thing to
do at a good party by nitro sucking shroom swallowing smoked
out speed snorting e-kid laying in hiz own puddlez of urine 
and multicolored vomit... Get what I'm sayin?
    Misunderstand me not, I've been more than my fair share 
of high before, but I've never been incoherent and I've never
not known what I've just put in my body. I've also never put
hellacious amounts of entheogenz in my body.
I've heard of people taking 4-5 hits of E within the same 
2 hourz trying to 'Get Off' az best they can. Ten hits of
acid disappear down the same manz throat. Half an ounce of 
shroomz 'tween teo people... Or how bout the first timer
with their paycheck in their pocket on Friday night answering
to every call of 'X' and 'Fry', az well az getting taken by
the venderz and people selling other shit. Why not make
it clear from the beginning of the party that you're not
suppozed to get all fucked up beyond belief. I've recently
seen a flier that stated right on the front that G would not
be tolerated within its doorz. Its not much by itself, but,
its a great start for what it's worth. There iz nothing 
wrong with getting your high on, but be selective when
wasting the limited grey matter. You only have so much of 
it and you can only get so high at one time... No matter
how much pot you smoke, you'll only get so stoned. No matter
how many hits of E you take, you're gonna get spun. There iz
no need to take more than two hits of acid, you're gonna fry.
You don't need to eat more than two eigths of shroomz cuz 
you're still gonna get off. This iz the Point that so many
have difficulty understanding, sillly az that might be. I 
guess some assume that 20 hits of Fry will make you see more
than 2-3 hits will. Might be true, but you'll be just az 
fuckin incapacitated so what doez it really matter? Sure 
you will relive the sinking of the Titanic after 1/2 oz. of
shroomz, but you'll be so fuckin shroomed out that you won't remember
shit about sinling anyway. So maybe it will feel
8 timez az good to drop 4 hits of X instead of 1 or 1-1/2.
Who carez if you're E'n so hard that your teeth grind and 
no one can understand a fuckin word your sayin... 
     I guess this iz nothing more than a warning early 
Easter 98 mornin for the purpose of lettin y'all know some
one iz concerned with the posterity of the scene, and I do wish
to keep all my party peops alive until we're old and decrepit
haz been fart knockerz doin dancez in front of our kidz
like our parents do in front of us... But if we keep destroyin
ourselvez, by not watching out for each other, where will
we be in the near future. What will we have in the near future.
Sure I can down 40 geltabz and not sweat it, but can I 
eazily and clearly what I waz doin exactly what I waz doin
1 year ago? 
    If reading this made you scratch your head or set off
a warning light somewhere in the back of that partied out
teenage brain of yourz, Take a sec to look at your involvement
in the scene... How involved are you really? How much are 
you doing really? What do you spend on drugz really? How many
different 1'z are you on at your partiez? 
I'm exhausted and can no longer continue, so pleaze feel 
free to get back to me any time you pleaze...    
    Only cuz I care...
-AlwayzSpun-
 
"The most violent element in Society iz Ignorance"

-source unknown-









==
The Cali 1 who'z AlwayzSpun,
livin life and havin fun...
Gettin high late at night,
Alwayz rollin through hiz life
Not knowin what to do or where to go
Eatin shroomz and snortin blow...
That nigga


--part0_892412168_boundary--

OH MY GOSH!!!!


 Anybody who was at JUSTICE LEAGUE last night to witness the madness, was
definetly part of something magical. DARA, DEGO, REBEL, STRETCH (Usher acca.
over Shy FX's "Bambata"......Holy Sh*t!) and MC M.A.D. ripped the place
apart!!!! The combination of the music and the Full moon created a  vibe I
haden't felt in a while.....truly a landmark for those who know and those who
are now realizing the weight of Drum & Bass. (The Reprezent show set the pace
I think.)

 Much respect to all who showed and gave up the energy....STRETCH's set was
made so easy by the crowd response. 

 Big, big ups to XLR8R, MAGIC CIRCLE, & BUGGING OUT & the TERRORIST SOCIETY
for joining forces and making the night happen. We forsee more nights like
this taking place this Summer!!!!...........prepare.


Peace,
Noel

okay see this is my opinion on this issue at hand~
    see the thing with me is that  i totally understand what is being said
about not wanting to give off the wrong impression... but i also agree with
trice...the fact is that everyone percieves raving as how they want to that is
just the bottom line....
    as far as baby ravers go--- i think that no matter what if they want to do
the drugs and go all out no one is going to stop them and as they fall and hit
rock bottom it is a process that has to be done in order for them to take that
step up into the knowledge and understanding of not always having to be fucked
up to have fun.... that fall is what makes you realize that you don't need to
continue doing all the drugs and what not....
  and also nobody can talk to them and tell them don't do this because all of
my life i was taught what drugs can do to you from D.A.R.E to when i found out
half of my family members were drug addicts.....i knew what was going to
happen as i got wrapped up in the drug world... i knew that i was going to
fall but that fall is what made me stand up again and now i am content with
going to a party sobar and knowing that i am not going to be hella cracked in
the morning.. it is a great feeling and you learn to accept and like  it and
the only thing that helped me was falling and learning from that fall.....
   i will tell you right now that i will still do those drugs every once in a
while but you know.. i am so happy that i took my step up...and the thing is
that i beleive i have to fall before i stand up and learn....   so anyways...
okay love always Moonbaby--Jenn

well on friday night mike and his crew came out to sacramento and picked me
up. it was fun to finally meet him and his boys....:c)
we headed out to the party to find a huge line awaiting us....
so we got in and took a look around. this party was at a roller skating rink
and had 2 rooms.
the main floor was the roller rink part and the second room was kinda a snak
bar put on you roller skates area. 
the music was alright, iam not to into house (which was in the 2cd room) and
in the main room there were some good points, but not many. the bassbin twins
were pretty good and i danced for a little while. 
now here comes the venting part of my night.........
the sacramento scene is so diffrent....
to me the whole scene out here is based on *image* 
i havent been to a party out here in like 2yrs, and iam telling you that i
really dident enjoy it. 
it wasent like if you werent part of a 'click' then you dident fit in.
no one came up to you sat down and said hi iam so and so how you doing
tonight.
and yeah i dident go up to anyone and try to conversate because well they just
dident seem to friendly. 
all in all i dont think i will go to another sac party. its just not my thing,
i much rather come down to sf and kick it with all of you. 
the highlight of my night was meeting mike, steve, and derek....
they are defenitly some cool boys and i had alot of fun with them, even though
after about three hrs of the party me and derek went to the car to rest
because we were so wore out. i defenitly had fun meeting thease guys and
chilling with them friday night.
mike....you are such a great guy, thanks so much for picking me up and haning
out with me!
steve....you are really cool, you had the funniest experession on your face in
the coffee shop, hope we can hang out again
derek....thanks for talking with me about life, it was defenitly a great
night!
thanks for letting me listen to you mix tape too (yo guys you gotta check out
this boys tape, it is really nice)
well there was my 2 cents on the whole thing, hope everyone had a good
weekend!

love...
amanda

Hey, how come no one has been posting about this party last night yet?  I had
expected a lot of responses about F8, and it is 8:00pm already, and not
one.... I guess every one is doing the holiday thing. 

I would just like to say that this party was one of the best parties in A LONG
TIME!!  

*Perfect amount of people ..
* Spectacular vibe, all around, every where.
* Great music, 
* Did I say Great music? ! 
* There was a lot of SF ravers.... I probably didn't even me all ya'll.
 Yes, I had a wonderful time, I hope there are more parties like the way this
one turned out.  I guess it all has to do with what you bring to the party to
share with others.  There was so much *ENERGY* there.  At one point during the
party, as I looked around me, EVERY ONE was dancing.  The whole house was
jumpin' up with the music, and even screaming with enthusiasm.  What a great
feeling, let me tell ya!!  
	It is amazing what music can do to you, the emotions it stirs up inside of
you.  Just from listening.  Music is a blessing.  It can raise conciousness
every which way, if you allow it to.  Hmm, well what did those of you who
attended think?? 
Alright, Happy Easter every one-
*Lisa*

From: Guytropix <Guytropix@aol.com>

Mime-Version: 1.0
Subject: Party at The Summit!!!
Content-type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 3.0 for Mac sub 82
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Ok, so there was Saturday night and I had nadda to do. I was just going to
call it quits at about 10pm, cause I had no $$$ and didnt plan on partying. So
just out of curiousity, I looked on the calender to see what parties besides
the gathering and f-8 were going on. Then I saw this post for a party that was
up in the SantaCruz mountains. I just had to go check it out!  It was free to
get in if you brought a can of food for donation. So I picked up Jason@thin
from the list, who I must say is an awesome guy who can party!!!, and we
headed out for the map point. It was at this little market right on top of the
summit area off of 17.  The party took us waaaaay up summit road to the slide
areas with roadblocks. The flyer said to just look for a bunch of cars and
park. So we found the place and did just that. We brought blankets and snacks,
wish was good thinking because it was heeeeellla cold and there was no food or
anything there. 

The vibe there was excellent, and when they finally got the generator started
and cables ran, it went off for the next 9 or 10 hours!!!! The music was so
awesome, really great trance and I think some goa trance too, then a jungle
set in the morning by this one girl who knew exactly what our ears needed!!!
The spot was cool, just right there in the middle of the road, because from
the point of the party and on, it was closed the rest of the way. It was a
little muddy, and as the peeps at Santuary today, my shoes were caked in it!
They had some hot chai(yum) and set up really cool tarps and chill areas. The
spot was pretty dark, and I couldnt see much in the night. This one girl took
me to see the most beautifull water fall up there, my eyes were just locked in
the flow of the water and sound of the whole area there. The party just
continued to go off, and it was still kind of going at around 8:30 when I
left. We got to see the most beautiful sunrise, with not a cloud in the sky.
We just all sat and watched mystified by the beauty of it all.......then I got
to see more of the space in the daylight, and it was prettier than I had ever
imagined!  The waterfall was so full of life and color, it was all so perfect.
I met Cat weasel, briefly, and Sukreta ( I know that isnt spelled right =(   ,
and she was a total sweeatheart. Then went to Jasons place and crashed for
about 3 hours, and off to sanctuary. I really wanted to have my mind and heart
more into it than it was, but I was so cracked that I just kind of sat and
chilled and didnt do a lot. But as always the sanctuary regs.  showed up with
smiles and good vibes. All in all, it has been a AWESOME 24 hours,....but
tomorrow its back to the daily crap....until VIBERATION!!!!!!  I will se you
all there! I hope every ones weekend has been as fun or more fun than mine.
Love you all, and party safe. 
W/Love&Harmony**and hugs!
Guytropix
